Since Simon has only five years' experience in business, so his profit is still too low to expand meaningfully, but he believes that a small amount of additional capital would positively change his life. For that reason, Simon has requested his first loan from Vision Finance Company and Kiva lenders to purchase a variety of shoes for sale.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of shoes for resale

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson, a 30-year-old father of three children between the ages of nine and one, hails from Nyamira Town in Western Kenya where he produces beans, tea and milk. His sales are to the government and the local market, and he earns additional income from his retail shop business in the market. He is hoping to have five cows within five years.

Now requesting 30,000 KES, this will be Samson's second from Juhudi Kilimo. His first loan of 20,OOO KES was repaid promptly. While he laments the poor market prices for his produce, he is confident of his ability to repay this loan and eventually qualify for an even larger amount.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Abdul Rahman

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Abdul, who is married and has one eight-year-old child. In 2005, Abdul established his used clothing business in order to become self-reliant. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 1663200 every month.

Abdul is requesting a loan of Le 3000000 to buy additional used clothes. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 332640. In the future, Abdul plans to be an international businessman, build a house and live a comfortable life. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy additional used clothes

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 25-year-old single man living and working in Nabatieh. Ali has owned a mobile phone sales and repair shop, in addition to selling rechargeable mobile phone lines, since 2008. Ali is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to buy more products for his shop, to increase his income and capital. His clients like dealing with him because they believe that his prices are better than somewhere else. He hopes to expand his business through wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more products for his shop

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia V. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 49 years old. Lydia is married and has three children who are 21, 19 and 17 years old. To make a living, Lydia owns and operates a business selling health and medicinal products in the local community. Lydia has been engaged in her business for over three years.

Lydia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lydia has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Lydia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 30 years old. He is married to Judy Kipkiton and he has two children who are 6 and 2 years old. He runs a hotel and a carpentry workshop, and also has rental houses. He has been in business for two years and his monthly income from the business is Kshs 10,000.

He is borrowing a loan of Kenya shillings 27,000 as his second loan to renovate his rental houses. He will use the anticipated income from the business to build more rental houses. 

Stephen dreams of buying more land that he will develop into commercial buildings as an investment for his family.

loans.use: Renovate rental houses

loans.name: Sheriff

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Sheriff. He is married and has two children, ages 16 and 5. He has eight additional dependents who live with him because they are his relatives. In 1995, Sheriff established his furniture business. He started his business because he wanted to be self-reliant. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 2611200 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan of Le 3000000 to buy additional furniture. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 522240. In the future, Sheriff plans to become a furniture supplier in the city of Bo. Sheriff also hopes to provide a comfortable life for himself and his family. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy furniture to sell

loans.name: Ganhuu

texts.en:
Ganhuu S. is 25 years old and lives with his wife and one-year-old son in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia’s capital city. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, which is owned by his mother. His mother owns several livestock and operates a milk trading business in the city. 

Since 2008, Ganhuu has been operating a taxi service, after working in the government's security agency as a supervisor. In addition, he sell goods out of his sister's market stall to supplement his earnings. After years of operation, he was able to renovate his car. Ganhuu is a clever and open minded man. He is requesting a 800,000 MNT loan to make repairs to his car and will give the remainder of the loan to his sister in order to increase the working capital of his part in his sister's consumer goods trading business.

loans.use: To make repairs to his car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Naidan

texts.en: Naidan Tserendor, 62 years old, lives with her two daughters in her own fenced-in house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her daughters both work. Her youngest daughter is planning to apply for an apartment leasing loan soon. Naidan operates a clothing retail business out of a rented stall at the Norjin trade center. She started her business in 2007 and has since built a stable and successful operation. Today, her working capital exceeds 3,000,000 MNT and her daily sales income has reached 50,000 MNT. In the future, she hopes to continue her success and purchase apartments for her children. She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to increase her working capital and help her daughter buy an apartment.

loans.use: to increase her working capital

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Kadiatu F.. She is married and has three children, ages 7, 12 and 15. In 1995, Kadiatu established her palm oil, soap and essential drugs business. She started her business because she wanted a way to help her husband support their family. Working six days a week and eight hours a day, she earns about Le 980,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan of Le 4,000,000 to add more stock to her business so she can increase profits. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 500,000. In the future, Kadiatu F. plans to expand her business, open a drugstore, and hire a sales person. Eventually, Kadiatu would like to pursue a career as as nurse. She is very hardworking and dedicated and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more palm oil

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu L. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 22 years old. Marichu owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Marichu is also an AVON dealer. She started selling to her friends and is now expanding her customer base.

Marichu joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marichu is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Marichu from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve it.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Busayra

texts.en:
Busayra M. is a young mother of four daughters. She is 31 years old. After finishing school in her native village in the south of Kyrgyzstan, she did not have an opportunity to continue her studies. To help her parents raise her brothers and sisters, she began to work as a seamstress. When she was 20, she got married and moved with her husband to Belovodskoe Village. Here they found jobs of a seamstress and mechanic, but they needed to find an additional means of subsistence for their family. 

In 2000, they started their cattle-breeding business with an initial sum of 2,000 Kyrgyz Soms. They worked hard and managed to expand their farm by building a barn and purchasing two bull-calves. Now Busayra plans to take a loan of 60,000 Kyrgyz Soms to buy two calves to fatten and resell. With the revenues, she plans to renovate her house and buy more cattle. Busayra is very hardworking person and does everything to provide her children with a prosperous future.  

About Bai-Tushum:
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Beatha

texts.en:
Beatha is 28 years old and married, with two children who are 5 and 6. Beatha’s husband is a farmer.  Farming is not very fruitful in this region so Beatha decided to help her husband provide the necessities for their family by starting her own business. The family works hard, especially Beatha, who sells different products such as water, juice, cosmetic products, and so on. She has been working in this business for 8 years now.

Beatha has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by purchasing more products for her shop. This loan will help her obtain more profit from her sales. With the extra profit, Beatha hopes to pay her children's school fees and to save money for the future.

loans.use: to purchase more water, juice, cosmetic products, etc.

loans.name: Murodjon

texts.en:
M. Murodjon is 22 years old and lives with his wife and parents. He is an animal farmer. Murodjon owns cows and sells their milk, with the help of his father. In order to further develop his business, Murodjon wants to take out a loan and buy one or two more cows and buy feed for them. After fattening them up, he will be able to sell them for a more favorable price, enabling Murodjon to use the profit from his business for his family's well-being.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase cows

loans.name: Mamadjon

texts.en:
G. Mamadjon is 24 years old. He is married and is the main bread-winner in his family. Mamadjon has a business baking “lepeshka”, the national bread.  He believes that this business is profitable and is not the subject to seasonality. He gets up early and bakes the lepeshka so that people have fresh bread on their tables for breakfast. He purchases all his supplies such as flour, salt and yeast at the local market. Due to high demand for his product, Mamadjon wants to increase the number of breads he bakes.  He is requesting a loan of $3000 US in order to purchase flour and coal for baking the “lepeshka”. Mamadjon deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase flour and coal for baking “lepeshka”

loans.name: Farman

texts.ru:
Farman B. 46 let. On jenat i imeyet 3 detey, doch 20 let i doch 19 let uchatsya v universitet a doch 15 let uchitsya v shkole. Farman jivet v Absheron regione vmesto so svoyey semyoy.

Farman uje 7 let zanimayetsya etim biznessom prodaji jenskoy odejdi. Kan vi videte na fotoqrafii on prodayet sherstyanuyu odejdu , etu odejdu  vajet jena Farmana , ranshe  eto pomesheniye im xvatalo no seychas  uje dochki Farmana toje nauchilis vazat( oni ochen lubat delat interesniye uzori na odejdax, lubat delat novshestva) i  poetomu u nix poluchayetsya mnoqo tovarov kotorix oni ne moqu pomestit v eto pomesheniye. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi rasshirit pomesheniye dlya razvitiya i prodaji mnoqo tovarov.
texts.en: Farman Bugadov is forty-six years old. He's married and has 3 daughters: twenty, nineteen and fifteen years old. The former two attend a university, while the younger daughter goes to school. They live in the Absheron region. For seven years, Farman has sold women's clothing, which his wife knits. Recently, his daughters have also started to knit (they really enjoy making interesting new designs on the clothing) and contribute their work for sale. However, Farman's shop isn't particularly large, so he has no room for this new inventory. He's asking for a loan of 2000 AZN to increase the area of his shop so he can put these products up for sale.

loans.use: To expand his shop

loans.name: Rosina

texts.en:
Rosina is married and has five children between the ages of 9 and 20 years. She has been in mixed farming for seven years. She produces eggs, milk, tea, and vegetables and sells them locally. Her challenges are animal diseases and limited access to poultry feeds. 

She has applied for this loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She plans to use the income to pay school fees for her children. She gets additional income from her retail shop business. She wants to expand her poultry business in five years to a volume of 100 chickens.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Ikromjon

texts.en:
Since 2004 S. Ikromjon has been a livestock farmer. He breeds sheep and cattle. He is married and he has 3 children for whom he needs to support and give a proper education. Ikromjon has improved his financial situation considering that his father is also cattle breeder and from his childhood he has gained a rich experience in the livestock business. Currently, his biggest dream is to expand his business and therefore, his biggest need is to get a loan in order to buy more cows. Ikromjon is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to improve his living.  

 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Teymur

texts.en:
Teymur R.  is a 31-year-old trader who keeps his own store in which he sells candies, chocolate, cookies, rice, beverages and other foodstuffs. 

Teymur gained experience by working in his father`s shop for many years before opening his own shop. Teymur started his business in 2008. This is his only source of income, as he is unemployed. 

He has applied for a loan in order to expand his stock of merchandise and thereby increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David A. is 33 years old, from the Khwisero area of Kakamega and is married to Joan. They have a son who is 10 years old. He is a tailor and has been in this business for the past year earning an income of Kshs 8,000 monthly. His business is strategically placed in the market place and he has many clients.

David is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy more materials to add to his stock. He also wants to service his sewing machine in readiness for the peak period during the Christmas festivals. David will use the profits made to buy another sewing machine.

His desire is to start a tailoring school in the future.

loans.use: To buy materials to add to his stock

loans.name: Zamaddin

texts.en:
Zamaddin N. is a 54-year-old entrepreneur who has sold various home products for the last seven years. Zamaddin`s shop is very popular among brides as the products he sells are dowry items.

Zamaddin is married and has three children. His elder son helps him sometimes, but this is his family's only source of income. He has applied for a loan in order to increase his income. He wishes to diversify his stock to include home furniture.

loans.use: To purchase home furniture for sale

loans.name: Babek

texts.en: Babek M. is 45 years old.  He is a trader who sells different kinds of foodstuffs in the small village of Sabirabad. He is married and has four children. Babek has five years of experience in this field.  His small market is very popular and always full of customers.  He wishes to increase the number of products he sells and thus increase his profit. This will allow him to cover all his family's needs as the shop provides the family's only income. Babek promises to repay the loan in the proper manner.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Soro

texts.en:
Y. Soro is 51 years old, married and has one child. She works at purchasing and reselling sheep with her husband. Soro is a hard-working woman who has fought to provide for her family and to educate her son, who today is a working adult, thanks to her example. She would like to request a loan of $1500 USD in order to purchase additional sheep to increase her inventory and to meet customer demands. Soro believes this will lead to greater revenue and, ultimately, greater profit for her family. In the future, she would like to reinvest the earnings generated by this loan back into her business. She will then purchase additional sheep and increase their income further. Soro deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving her.     


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase sheep to expand the business.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando L. is from the town of Trinidad. He is 36 years old. Rolando is married and has 3 children: aged 12, 11 and 1. To make a living, Rolando owns & operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Rolando works hard to sustain his children's education. He wants them to finish college and to have bright futures.

Rolando joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Rolando has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Rolando is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Rolando from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Bahman

texts.ru:
Bahman K. 44 qoda. On jenat i imeyet 4 detey, doch kotoroy 19 let ona  uchitsya v kolledje, sin 18 zanimayetsya sportom, doch 16 let i sin 14 uchatsya v shkole. Bahman i yeqo semya jivut v Absherob regione.

Bahman ranshe bil taksistom no  uje 8 let kak imeyet etu mashinu dlya perevozki cementa(betonameshalka), Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti dlya etoy mashini.
texts.en:
Bahman K. is 44 years old.  He is married and has four children.  His nineteen-year-old daughter goes to college.  His eighteen-year-old son plays sports.  His sixteen-year-old daughter and fourteen-year-old son go to school.  Bahman and his family live in the Absheron region.

Bahman used to be a taxi driver, but for the last eight years, he has owned his own cement truck.  Now, he needs 2000 AZN to buy parts for his truck.

loans.use: Buying car parts

loans.name: Francois

texts.en:
Francois is 50 years old and he is married. He has five children between the ages of 2 and 12 years old. He employs three people. Francois has been a taxi driver for fifteen years. He gets up at 5 am every day to start transporting people to their work places. He pays rent each day to the owner of the taxi.

Francois is requesting a loan to buy his own land. His goal is to send all his children to school and to build a house for his family.

loans.use: To buy land.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente E. is from the town of Trinidad. He is 57 years old. Vicente is married and has 6 children. To make a living, Vicente owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Vicente also tills a parcel of land where he plants and harvests rice crops. He harvests the crops to sell and to use for his own family's consumption.

Vicente joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Vicente has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Vicente is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets and feed. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for his children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and feed.

loans.name: Nuriddin

texts.en:
G. Nuriddin is married. His family lives in Shahrituz, Southern Tajikistan. Nuriddin sells household chemicals and perfumes in his shop. Small ventures like Nuriddin’s become the only source of income for families in remote parts of Tajikistan. Nuriddin has been in the trade for 6 years. His business is characterized by stability and positive performance. Inventory he sells is always in demand as people need dishwasher and laundry soap, shampoos, and perfumes and other household chemicals. Nuriddin wants to see his business grow in the future, which is why he is requesting a loan of $3000 USD to increase his turnover capital. He is hoping to boost further development of his business with this additional assistance. 

 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase turnover capital related to household chemicals and perfumes sold.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.es:
Ninfa R. es una señora de 46 años  y  tiene 3 hijos, uno de ellos aun en edad escolar. Ninfa esta casada y su marido quien se dedica a trabajar en un taxi de su propiedad, con lo que se complementa la economía de la familia.

La Sra. posee una despensa desde hace unos diez años. Así también, paralelamente a las ventas realizadas en la despensa pone a disposición de sus clientes comidas rápidas, ensaladas de fruta, actividades con las que complementa su despensa. 

El crédito obtenido de la Fundación Paraguaya piensa invertirlo en la compra de mercaderías, de manera a tener un stock de productos mas variados como carne, verduras, bebidas, etc. El futuro proyecto de Ninfa es incluir venta de helados a su despensa. 

Ninfa Agradece el crédito obtenido, pues le permite crecer en su emprendimiento y acercarse de manera mas rápida a los objetivos que se propone.
texts.en:
Ninfa R. is 46 years old and has 3 children, one of them still of school age. Ninfa is married, and her husband works as a taxi driver using his own vehicle, which contributes to the family's economic support. 

Ninfa has run a small store for the past ten years. At the same time, besides the sales she makes in her store, she also offers her customers fast foods and fruit salads. She does this work in addition to her work in the store. 
 
She has invested the loan she obtained from the Paraguaya Foundation in buying merchandise, so that she can have a more varied inventory of products, such as meat, vegetables, beverages, etc. Ninfa's plan for the future is to add ice cream sales to her store. 

Ninfa appreciates the loan she has received, because it is allowing her to grow as an entrepreneur and reach her goals more quickly.

loans.use: Buying merchandise for her store, such as noodles, rice, sugar, vegetables, beverages and snacks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen M. is married to Abraham Kimathi and they have one child who is three years old. Hellen is 32 years old and has one year of experience in the wholesale stocking of bottled water, which she resells to retail shop owners in the area. By ensuring prompt delivery to her customers, she has made her customers loyal and her business successful.

Hellen has now applied for her first loan with KADET LTD which she will use to buy bottled water worth 10,000 KES. The remaining 20,000 KES will be used to buy computer accessories like printer cartridges, keyboards, and mice for use in her business.

She would like to see her business grow to a bigger store in the future.

loans.use: To purchase bottled water and computer accessories.

loans.name: Azbaraga

texts.en: Azbaraga E. is 56 years old, married with six children. He has raised cattle in the small village of Sabirabad since 2005. Azbaraga has one dairy cow and his income comes from selling milk and yoghurt.  He is applying for a loan to buy two more cows. The demand for milk products is very high and he wishes to cover all the needs of his clients. He already repaid two loans successfully and AqroInvest counts him as a trustworthy client.

loans.use: To purchase two dairy cows

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Adja a 49 ans et est veuve. Elle a en charge 4 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de condiments pour améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants. Elle a employé aussi une personne qui l’aide dans ses activités. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et compte dans cette activité près de 3 ans. Elle expose ses différents produits à la devanture de sa maison à Bè adidomé à côté de l’église Notre Dame de Lomé. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour augmenter son commerce.
texts.en: Adja is a 49 year old widow. She cares for four children. She re-sells condiments in order to improve the condition of her life and the lives of her children. She also employs an additional person to help with her business. She purchases supplies for her business from the large market in Lomé and has been in this business for almost three years. She sells a variety of products behind her house in Bè Adidome, near Notre Dame of Lomé. She is requesting this loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase condiments

loans.name: T. Jeanne

texts.fr: G. T. Jeanne est née le 13 Juillet 1981 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Jeanne est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés, mais Jeanne ne vit plus avec son mari. Jeanne vit seule depuis cinq ans environs à Midombo, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Jeanne a très peu fréquenté l'école, mais a appris la coiffure, une activité qu'elle mène passionnément depuis environs quatre ans. Parallèlement, Jeanne vend dans son atelier de coiffure, des mèches et des produits cosmétiques. Jeanne s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. La clientèle de Jeanne s'accroît au jour le jour et pour ce faire, Jeanne désire agrandir davantage son activité afin de mieux répondre aux différentes demandes de ses clients. C'est la raison pour laquelle Jeanne sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé. Jeanne a bien remboursé le crédit antérieur qu'elle a reçu de ALIDé.
texts.en:
G. T. Jeanne was born on the 13th of July, 1981 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. Jeanne is the mother of two children, both of whom are attending school, but Jeanne no longer lives with her husband. Jeanne has lived alone for the past five years in the area of Midombo, a neighborhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. 

Jeanne attended very little school, but learned hairdressing and has been passionately running a  hairdressing business for about four years. Additionally, Jeanne sells goods from her hair salon, such as hair extensions and cosmetics. Jeanne purchases supplies for her business in Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin. Jeanne's clientele is growing every day and, as a result, she wants to further expand her business to better meet the various demands of her customers. That is why Jeanne is requesting another loan from the micro-finance organization ALIDÉ. Jeanne has repaid the earlier loan she received from ALIDÉ.

loans.use: To purchase hair care products and beauty products for her business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 26 years old and is married to Joseph I.. They have two children aged 3 and 1. Margaret’s husband contributes in supporting the family. Margaret operates a tailoring shop in the Githurai 44 market.  Her tailoring business has been in operation for 4 years. Her monthly income is Kshs 12,000. Githurai is a highly populated area and Margaret is targeting the Christmas holiday to make intensive sales.

She was introduced to KADET by existing KADET clients. This will be Margaret’s first loan with KADET LTD.  With the loan she intends to purchase fabric and buy some second-hand clothes to sell.  She will get orders from schools and companies to make uniforms for the beginning of next year.

Margaret hopes to have a big tailoring shop and eventually train young girls so that they can earn some income.

loans.use: To add stock of fabric, used clothes, and other material.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 26-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and one child. He has been working as a farmer for the past fifteen years and in 2000, he started working independently on his own land, raising cattle. He produces dairy products such as milk, yogurt, etc. he is thankful for his business income; he is able alone to cover the household expenses.

Today, he is requesting to borrow US$ 1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase fertilizers and feed for the cattle to give a good quality of products for the coming season, knowing that in Lebanon the majority of housewives prepare home products to use all through the year. In the future, he is planning to purchase more cattle in order to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and feed

loans.name: Odette

texts.fr: Née en 1980 à Calavi, une ville du Bénin, T. Odette est mariée à OSSA Mathieu, un coiffeur. Odette est mère de quatre enfants tous scolarisés. La famille vit depuis douze ans à Adogléta un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Le couple a six personnes à charges et se partage ensemble les charges familiales. Odette mène comme activité la vente de nourriture (riz, haricot) à son domicile. Cela fait maintenant dix ans que Odette exerce cette activité. Odette achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché populaire du Bénin. Odette a déjà bénéficié de sept prêts qui ont été tous très bien remboursés. C’est dans l’optique d’améliorer la qualité de ses repas que Odette désire obtenir un huitième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Odette souhaite augmenter son fond de roulement
texts.en: Born in 1980 in Calavi, a town in Benin, Odette T. is married to Mathieu Ossa, a hairdresser.  Odette is a mother of four children in school.  The family has lived in Adogléta, a neighborhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, for twelve years.  The couple have six dependents and share the family expenses. Odette runs a business selling food (rice and beans) from her home. She has been running this business for the past ten years. She buys her products at the popular Dantokpa market. Odette has received seven loans and she has reimbursed all of them. With a view of improving the quality of products, Odette seeks her eighth loan with ALIDé. Odette hopes to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice and beans and condiments.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 37 years old and is married with five children who are between 4 and 13 years old. Vestine is well known for her new clothing sales, which are currently mostly children’s clothes. She has been in this business for about twelves years and the hours of her business are from 7 am to 8 pm.

Vestine is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding her business by adding a variety of styles such as men’s and women’s clothes.  With this loan, she has a vision of wholesaling and retailing at the same time so she can increase her revenue.

If successful, Vestine hopes to continue building a secure future for her family and additionally, she will help the people from her community by employing them.

loans.use: To purchase more men's and women's clothes

loans.name: Normumin

texts.en:
Normumin is 51 years old, married with 9 children. Normumin has worked in agriculture since he was a young. His father taught him how to responsibly work with each crop and now with the help of his wife and adult children, he feels a sense of dignity from his work. As a consequence, he treats each plant with affection and care until they are ready for harvest, at which point he takes them to sell in the market. Normumin would very much like to buy a house in the city to ensure the well-being and tranquility of his children and in this way improve his quality of life. The money that he is soliciting is for the purchase of seeds, chemical fertilizers, fuels and lubricants. Let’s support this hard-working and talented man so that he can obtain his goals!
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds, chemical fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Louise

texts.fr: A. Louise est née le 25 août 1972 à Adjohoun, un quartier de Porto-Novo, capitale politique du Bénin.  Louise est divorcée et réside à Midombo dans la capitale économique du Benin depuis environs cinq ans. Louise a fréquenté l’école et s’est arrêté au cours secondaire. Louise vit seule  et n’a aucun enfant mais a quatre personnes à sa charge qui sont tous scolarisées. Louise assure seule les charges des personnes à sa charge. Louise mène comme activité principale la vente  d’images, de statuts religieux, de bougies, etc. depuis dix ans à son domicile. Louise a bénéficié de deux prêts qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Dans le cadre de l’augmentation de son stock de produit Louise sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Louise ambitionne diversifier son activité par l'achat de haricot en vue de stocker et de revendre plus tard.
texts.en: Louise A. was born August 25, 1972 in Adjohoun, a neighborhood of Porto-Novo, the capital of Benin. Louise is divorced and has lived in Midombo for five years. Louise attended school but stopped at high school. Louise lives alone and has no children, but she has four dependents who are all in school.  She is their sole provider. Louise has business selling religious goods from her home, (such as images, statues, candles, etc.) which she has run for the past ten years. Louise has received two previous loans and completely reimbursed both. To increase her product stock, Louise seeks her third loan from ALIDé. She hopes to diversify her activities by buying beans, with plans to stock and resell them later.

loans.use: To buy religious articles (Bibles, incense, images, holy oil)

loans.name: Yuldosh

texts.en:
T. Yuldosh is 56 years old. He is married and has 5 children. For 11 years Yuldosh has been growing agricultural production on his land together with the help of his children. He grows wheat, rice, oats and watermelon on his land. He wants to borrow the loan for purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer for processing the land. So that Yuldosh is asking for a loan of $2000 USD. You could become an important part in Yuldosh family's life, he deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 30 years old and married to Gladys Chebet who is 26 years old. They have one child, Dennis Kiprono, who is three years old. Edward has five years experience in the video editing business that he and his wife operate. His clientele comprises middle and lower class clients who require video coverage, especially for celebrations like weddings, birthdays and other special days.

Edward has serviced another loan of KES 40,000 with KADET and has repaid successfully. This will be his second loan with which he will buy another video editing machine. The idea behind buying a better editing machine is to provide better quality photos and videos and to improve efficiency within his business. Edward, who attends evening classes, is hoping that with the new editing machine he will be able to clear more work and thus have time to attend his classes comfortably.

He wants to be able to provide for all of his family's basic needs.

loans.use: To buy a video editing machine

loans.name: Awussu

texts.fr: Awusu a 34 ans et est marié.  Il est né à Lomé et habite quartier Kégué.  IL est couturier de profession et exerce cette activité il y a 3 ans déjà. Il s’approvisionne au marché local de Kégué  et  a un apprenti qui l’aide dans ses tâches. Le crédit demandé permettra d’acheter une machine pour mieux satisfaire les clients.
texts.en: Awusu is 34 years old and married.  He was born and lives in the Kégué neighborhood of Lomé. He has been a professional designer for the past three years. He stocks up at the local Kégué market and has an apprentice who helps him with his tasks. The loan requested will allow him to buy a machine, which will better satisfy his clients.

loans.use: To buy a machine

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en:
Tahir B. is a 56-year-old farmer who raises seasonal fruits and vegetables in the small village of Sabirabad. He has raised crops since 2005 and all the members of his large family help him. Tahir has three children. 

Tahir usually sells crops in the central bazaar or to local traders. He would like to produce a new type of apple for next season and he needs good seeds and fertilizer. That is what he is going to buy with his loan.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for crops

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 22-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his family. He has been working in construction for the past five years. He is specialized in smoothing building boards. He works on a freelance basis upon request of his clients. He participates in covering the family expenses.

Today, he is requesting to borrow US$ 1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase scaffolding for his business. He believes that the loan amount will be very useful for his business needs. He is confident that his work will continue to be successful in the coming year.

loans.use: to purchase scaffolding

loans.name: Ceciliah Wangeci

texts.en:
Cecilia has practiced farming in Njabini town for the last 11 years. She is a 50-year-old single mother of one child.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her second loan. She paid her first loan of KES 20,000 in full and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizers and potato seedlings for planting.

In the future she hopes to buy more land and practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: To buy fertiliser and potato seedlings for planting

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David has been doing mixed farming in his hometown of Nyamira in Western Kenya for the last 35 years.  He produces tea, tomatoes, cabbages, milk, maize, and beans, selling all locally save for the tea, which goes to Kenya Tea Development Authority.  He is married with two children, both of school-going age.

He has requested this loan amounting to 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow.  He hopes this will improve their milk income and educate their two children.  He aspires to own a greenhouse.

He sees lack of farm supplies like fertilizer due to their high costs as the greatest impediment.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: C4591 Tuzamurane Group

texts.en:
Therrie is the group leader of five members who call themselves Tuzamurane.  They each have their own business. 

Therrie is 23 years old and is currently single.  He sells clothing in Kimironko district in Rwanda.  Therrie sells different kinds of clothes.  The hours of his business are from 8am to 6pm. This is his fourth successful year selling clothing.

Therrie has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his businesses through purchases of a variety of clothes. This will allow him to support his other family members.  Therrie and his group expect to earn more profits from the investments made from the loan, which will help them to save money for their future.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing

loans.name: Aboudou Nassirou

texts.fr: Nassirou a 34 ans  et père de 3 enfants. Pour s’occuper de ses enfants, il exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu, la vente de produits d’alimentations générale et cumule près de 3 ans dans cette  activité. Il s’approvisionne au  marché de hédzranawoe et revend à côté de Fossi Sono. Il sollicite ce prêt pour se réapprovisionner.
texts.en: Nassirou is 34 years old with 3 children.  To earn money to take care of his children, he has been selling food products for the last 3 years.  He buys his stock in the Hédzranawoé market and re-sells it in nearby Fossi Sono.  He is requesting this loan to buy more stock.

loans.use: purchase of food products

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en: Kamal G. is a 50-year-old farmer who has been growing vegetables and raising cattle in the Internal Displaced People Settlement for the last seven  years.  He is working in the local post office but his salary is too small to cover the needs of four children. He currently has two cows which produce milk. Kamal sells dairy to the local people. His son is helping him look after the cows. He plans to buy one more cow. Kamal had previously taken out a loan from AqroInvest and had successfully repaid it.

loans.use: To purchase a cow and fodder

loans.name: Félicienne

texts.fr: Née le 07 mars 1975 à Ouidah au Bénin, S. Félicienne est mariée KOKI Gérard, un peintre auto. Félicienne est mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés. Félicienne vit avec son mari et ses enfants à Midombo depuis environs seize ans, un quartier de la ville de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Félicienne assure avec son mari les charges de famille. Félicienne n’a jamais fréquenté et mène comme activité principale la vente de tissus depuis vingt cinq ans. Félicienne exerce comme activité secondaire la vente de divers produits (sucre, chips). Félicienne s’approvisionne à Dantokpa  marché international du Bénin. Félicienne a déjà obtenu deux crédits auprès de ALIDé dont le dernier a été remboursé avec quelques difficultés dû à la maladie de son enfant. Félicienne ambitionne élargir son activité, raison pour laquelle elle sollicite un autre crédit.
texts.en:
Born March 7, 1975 in Ouidah, Benin, Félicienne S. is married to Gerard KOKI, a car painter. She is the mother of three children, all in school. She has been living with her husband and children in Midombo, a district of the city of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, for about sixteen years. 

The couple provide together for their family. Félicienne, who never attended school, has been selling fabrics for twenty five years. As a secondary business, she also sells various products (sugar, crisps). She gets her stocks in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. 

Félicienne has already obtained two loans from ALIDé, the last of which was repaid with some difficulty due to one of her children being ill. 

Félicienne‘s goal is to expand her business, which is why she is requesting another loan.

loans.use: Purchase of fabrics and various products

loans.name: Hadidja

texts.en:
Hadidja is 28 years old and married, and she has 2 children who are 7 and 3 years old. Hadidja is known as a proven entrepreneur who sells charcoal wholesale and retail. This is her 10th successful year in this business which she runs from 6 am to 8 pm every day.  Hadidja is pictured here with her sacks of charcoal, which have been stuffed and then covered with eucalyptus leaves, ready for sale.

Hadidja has requested a Kiva loan through Vision Finance Company to expand her business by creating many sources of income from the same charcoal business, and to provide jobs to the people of her community. With this loan, Hadidja hopes that her revenue will increase so she can save for her future and do her best for her children.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en: Ramil A. is a 32-year-old trader who sells different kinds of foodstuff. Ramil is married and has two sons. He started his business in 2006 and since that time he has gained respect among the local people. The demand in foodstuff is very high and he is not able to meet it. He needs to buy additional food products to increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuff to sell

loans.name: Theoneste

texts.en:
Theoneste is 33 years old and married with three children between 1 and 5 years of age.  Theoneste is a motorbike taxi driver. He provides the service of transportation in his region.  The hours of his work are from 5 in the morning to 10 in the evening every day, except on Saturday.  Theoneste has been providing this service for five years.

Theoneste has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to improve his family's economic situation by creating another business of selling shoes. This new business will be operated by Theoneste's wife in order to help her contribute to their family.  Both will work hard for their family and community.  They would like to also buy a house and a new motorcycle with the profits.

loans.use: To create a new shoe sales business

loans.name: Bakir

texts.ru:
Bakir G.  42 qoda. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey , sin kotoromu 17 let i sin kotoromu 15 let uchastya v shkole i oba zanimayutsya shaxmatami. Bakir jivet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. 

Bakir uje 6 let kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom prodaji pasud aksesuarov dlya doma. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit posudu i aksesuari dla doma, novix raznix form.
texts.en:
Bakir G. is 42 years old.  He is married and has two children.  His two sons, ages fifteen and seventeen, go to school and play chess.  Bakir and his family live in the Absheron region.

Bakir has been selling dishes and housewares for six years.  Now, he needs 2000 AZN to buy new and different dishes and housewares.

loans.use: Buying new goods

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 41-year-old single woman from Lebanon. This talented woman is paralyzed and despite her situation, she opened accessories and gadgets shop in 2007 and she has proven to be a successful entrepreneur. She adds a tailoring service to her shop. This will be her third loan and she is very thankful for the results. She has been a reliable Ameen client and has repaid on time for the loan duration. She was even able to complete her last payment one month earlier than her scheduled date. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase her shop inventory of new accessories and gadgets. She is very optimistic about her business growth in the coming year.

loans.use: to increase her shop inventory

loans.name: Elvina

texts.en:
Elvina M. is a 26-year-old trader who is married with three children.  She works in the small village of Sabirabad city. 

Elvina brings different kind of goods from Baku city which is three hours away from her house. She sells home products, perfumes, and dowry gifts from her house. She has her own business since 2003 and has already gained a lot of clients. Her sister helps her a lot to attract more clients. 

 She has applied for a loan to increase the number of items for sale to increase her profit.

loans.use: To purchase products for resale

loans.name: Claire Suzanne

texts.fr: A. O. Claire Suzanne est née le 12 août 1971 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Claire Suzanne est mariée et mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés, avec qui elle vit. La famille vit à Sènadé 2, un quartier de Cotonou. Claire Suzanne supporte seule les besoins de ses enfants. Pour assurer les charges familiales, Claire Suzanne exerce comme activité depuis quinze ans, la vente de bombons, biscuits, conserves, etc. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Claire Suzanne s’approvisionne. Claire Suzanne est une cliente fidèle de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. C’est dans le but d’accroitre son activité et fructifier ses revenus que Claire Suzanne sollicite un nouveau crédit.
texts.en:
Claire Suzanne A. O. was born on August 12, 1971 in Cotonou, economic capital of Benin. She is married, and her three children, who are all living with her, are in school. The family lives in Sènadé 2, a neighborhood in Cotonou. She alone meets her children's needs.

In order to pay her family's expenses, Claire Suzanne has been selling candy, cookies, canned goods, etc. for fifteen years. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, Benin's international market.

Claire Suzanne is a loyal ALIDé customer who repays her loans. With the goal of expanding her business and increasing her income, she is seeking a new loan.

loans.use: Purchase of boxes of cookies, candy, and various other products

loans.name: Vagif

texts.en: Vagif M. is a 58-year-old beekeeper who makes honey in the small village of Imishli city. He engaged in this business in 2003 because his pension  was not enough  to  cover  his family's needs.  He is married and has five children, all of them are helping him and are learning this business to continue it.  Vagif has applied for a loan to buy 3 beehives.

loans.use: To purchase 3 beehives

loans.name: Jyanbere Group

texts.fr: Jean K. et agriculteur du riz, et il est un membre du groupe Jyanbere.  Il a 32 ans, il est marie, et il a 4 enfants entre 1 an et 8 ans.  Un de ses enfants va à l’école.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter les fertilisantes urées et NPK, et aussi pour la main d’œuvre.  Il voudrait améliorer l’activité de l’agriculture du riz, et il voudrait aussi payer les frais scolaires pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Jean K. is a rice farmer and a member of the Jyanbere group. He is 32 years old, married, and has four children between 1 and 8 years old. One of his children attends school.

He will use his loan to purchase urea and NPK (nitrogen-phosphorus-potassium) fertilizers, and also to pay for labor. He would like to improve his rice-farming business and also pay his family's school fees.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and labor

loans.name: Louise Benthe

texts.fr: Louise a 47 ans et est mariée. Elle est née au Cameroun mais vit à Lomé. Elle gère comme activité génératrice de revenus la vente de débit de boissons  ce qui lui permet d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle s’approvisionne à la Brasserie BB Lomé et revend dans un bar à Aguiarkomé. Elle compte aussi dans cette activité près de 2 ans. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour augmenter sa marge  bénéficiaire.
texts.en:
Louis is 47 years old and married. She was born in Cameroon but lives in Lomé. To earn her living, she does business in alcohol and drink sales, which allows her to improve her family's living conditions. She gets her supplies at the BB Lomé Brewery and sells them at a bar in Aguiarkomé. 

She has been in this business for almost two years. She is seeking a loan to increase her profit margin.

loans.use: Purchase of drinks

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Adalet

texts.en: Adalet M. is 53 years old and is married with six children. He has been breeding sheep for the last eight years. He is working as a doctor. Currently he has 30 sheep and wants to increase his flock. He has applied for 1000 AZN loan to buy 30 lambs. He dreams to have a farm with 300 heads of sheep.

loans.use: To purchase 30 lambs

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
Zahida lives in a historic city in Pakistan called Lahore. Lahore is the 2nd largest city of Pakistan and known for its history and culture. She lives there in a 2-room brick house with her family in the area named Nawaz Moore. 

She is a 35-year-old lady who gave birth to 2 sons and 2 daughters.  Only her daughter is able to get an education and is studying in 3rd class. Her elder son operates his own business and the younger one works in a factory.
 
Her husband has a business selling fruits and vegetables. His shop is located in the market from where he operates his business.  Zahida herself is a seamstress. She works fulltime, receiving orders from her neighboring clients and sewing beautiful clothes to earn an income for the family. 

Zahida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy more seasonal fruits & vegetables to sell  through his shop. He has been doing this business for over 20 years and Zahida is hopeful that after an investment, her husband’s business will grow further and make him larger profits. 

She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits & vegetables for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
Rani supports her family financially by doing embroidery work. She receives orders from her neighborhood clients and completes their orders on time to earn an income. 

Her husband is an electrician by profession. He offers electricity repairing services to his clients and also sells electrical items such as tube lights, switches and bulbs. He does his business by operating a small shop in the market and has more than 30 years of experience in his field. 

Rani has given birth to 3 daughters. Only her 2nd daughter is able to get education and the others stay at home.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy the latest repairing tools and also buy electrical items such as tube lights, bulbs, and switches to further improve his business. 

Rani is hopeful that her husband, with a vast experience in his field, will successfully be able to improve his business condition with the help of a loan investment. 

She lives in a city called Lahore in Pakistan. Lahore city is known for its history and culture. She lives there with her family in a 2-room brick house. She is a new loan applicant for Asasah and hopes it will bring good profits to her family. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Rani.

loans.use: To buy electrical repair tools and items

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en:
Elchin M. is a 29-year-old entrepreneur who has his own barber shop.  He has been engaged in this business for the last six years. He is married and has two sons. He is working and living in  Internally Displaced Persons Settlement in Bilasuvar. 

Elchin needs more funds to expand his business.  He used his first loan to make small renovations in his barber shop and now he would like to make his business bigger and expand to a new place.

loans.use: To expand barber shop business

loans.name: Akif

texts.ru:
Akif H. 41 qod. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey , doch kotoroy 18 let  uchitsya v kolledje i sin kotoromu 15 let on uchitsya v shkole. V Absheron regione Akif i yeqo semya jivut v kvartirantov.

Akif uje 10 let kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom taksista. Tak kak yeqo mashina isportilas seychas on Nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti dlya taksi potomu on ne mojet vozit kliyentov. Emu nujno vseqda imet rabotu tak kak on doljen oplachivat uchebi svoix detey.
texts.en:
Akif H. is 41 years old.  He is married and has two children.  His eighteen-year-old daughter studies at college, and his fifteen-year-old son goes to school.  Akif and his family rent an apartment in the Absheron region.

Akif has been driving a taxi for the past ten years.  His automobile has broken down.  Now, he needs 2000 AZN to buy repair parts for his taxi.  He is currently unable to drive his customers.  He needs steady work because he has to pay his children’s school fees.

loans.use: Buying spare parts for a taxi

loans.name: Shareefan's Group

texts.en:
Shareefan is a talented lady who operates an embroidery business to financially support her family. She is very skillful in her art and receives regular orders from her neighboring clients every month. She is also a very good housewife and does her household responsibilities very well. 

She is married to Q. M. who is also involved in an embroidery business. He operates his shop in the market where he offers different designs of embroidery to his customers. His unique works helps him to introduce his talent to many more customers.  

She is a mother of a son who also does embroidery work. Embroidery has become their family business.

Shareefan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her husband expand his embroidery business. With the loan, he will buy an embroidery machine and also hire a worker who will assist him in his work. This will help him fulfill orders on time. 

She is a new loan applicant for Asasah and this is her first loan application.

loans.use: To buy embroidery machine & hire worker

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane has been doing mixed farming in her hometown of Nyamira for eight years. She has seven children with only one left in school. She produces tea, vegetables and milk. Her tea is mostly sold to the Kenya Tea Development Authority and the rest at the local market.

She has requested this loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, her second loan after the first of 40,000 KES. She intends to improve her family's living standards and pay school fees for the child in school.She plans to expand her land through purchasing more.

Her challenge remains unreliable farmhands. She acknowledges Juhudi's  loan services.

loans.use: Purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Calal

texts.ru:
Calal H. 24 qoda. On ne jenat i jivet v Asbheron regione. On jivet odin v obshejitie kvartirantom. Svoyey rabotay on pomoqayet i svoyey semye tak kak yeqo otec ochen bolen i ne mojet rabotat. Tak kak yeqo otec bolen on po etoy prichine brosil uchebu i  nachal rabotat chtobi pomoch semye , v budushem on xochet  opat uchitsya  yesli konechno je pozvolyat vozmojnosti.

Calal uje 4 qoda kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom prodaji odejdi. Ranshe on ne imel pomesheniya dlya prodaji i poetomu prodoval na rukax . Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit noviye zimniye tovari dlya pereprodaji.
texts.en:
Calal H. is 24 years old.  He is single and lives in the Absheron region.  He lives alone in a dormitory.  He helps his family by working.  His father is very ill and cannot work.  Because his father is so ill, Calal gave up his studies to work and help his family.  In the future, he would like to start studying again if it ever becomes possible.

Calal has been in the business of selling clothes for four years.  Earlier, he did not have a shop, so he sold clothes he carried by hand.  Now, he needs 2000 AZN to buy new winter clothes for resale.

loans.use: buy goods resale.

loans.name: Dufatanye Bakozi Group

texts.fr: Jean de Dieu H. est une mécanique, et il est un membre du groupe Dufatanyebakozi.  Il a 28 ans, et il a 3 enfants entre 3 ans et 7 ans.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 pignons, 10 pneus, 10 chaines, 5 paquets de rayons, et 30 cabres d’accélérateurs pour son affaire.   Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de payer ce crédit à temps et sollicite un autre crédit avec beaucoup d’argent, alors il peut augmenter son affaire.  Il voudrait s’autofinancer lui-même, et il voudrait développer sa famille et payer les frais d’études pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jean de Dieu H. is a mechanic, and he is a member of the Dufatanyebakozi group. He is 28 years old and has three children between three and seven years old.

He will use his loan to buy 10 pinions, 10 tires, 10 chains, 5 packets of spokes, and 30 accelerator cables for his business. His strategy for increasing business is to pay this loan on time and seek another loan with a lot of money, so that he can expand his business. He would like to be self-financing, and he would like to enlarge his family and pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: Purchase of pinions, tires, chains, spokes and accelerator cables

loans.name: Ruqqiya's Group

texts.en:
Ruqqiya has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her husband who has a business selling construction supplies. He operates his shop in the market where he offers construction supplies like cement, bricks and sand etc to his customers. With the loan, he will buy more construction supplies to provide quality services to his customers and fill their orders on time. 

Ruqqiya lives in the area called Nawaz Moore with her family in a 2-room brick house. She is located in Lahore which is the 2nd largest city of Pakistan and known for its history and culture. She has been living there for past 10 years.
 
She herself is a housewife, spending most of her time at home doing her household work. She also sews clothes for neighborhood customers when she is free from the household work. She is very skillful with her hands.

She has given birth to three sons. Unfortunately, none of them could get an education due to poor financial conditions. So they all started doing work. Her first two sons are drivers by trade and the youngest one works in a factory for a low income. 

Her husband has been doing his business for over 10 years, and Ruqqiya is hopeful that a loan investment will be a  profitable one for her husband and will make him more income than before. She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies for construction supply selling business

loans.name: C4590 Abizerwa Group

texts.en:
Marianne is 46 years old and is married with three children who are 7, 10 and 12 years old. She is the president of a group called “Abizerwa” and this group is commonly known for selling vegetables. This is their third successful year in this business, which they operate from 5 am to 6.30 pm every day.

Marianne and her team are requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of increasing the quantity of vegetables they sell at the market. With this expansion, this group really hopes their profits will increase. In addition, each member of the group will start saving and be able to satisfy the basic needs of their family.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of vegetables

loans.name: Kapamba Group

texts.en:
Segereta M. is in her early forties and is married with three children. For the past two years, Seregeta has been running her own pharmacy shop . The store is open between 08:00 am and 09:00 pm and earns Seregeta a low monthly profit. 

This will be Segereta's second "Motisha" loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. A "Mothisha" loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. Segereta used her previous loan to increase the stock of medicine for her business. This loan has now been successfully repaid. With her second loan, Segereta aims to once again increase her stock of medicine. Segereta's dream is to one day have a big and modern pharmacy. 

Segereta will share this loan with her loan group Kapamba, which totals 9 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans. 

In the picture, Segereta can be seen wearing white and black, 1st on the right.

loans.use: To buy more medicines

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
Cesar is 31 years old and is married with one child who is 2 years old.  He runs a supermarket in Rwamagana district in Rwanda.  Cesar is a self-employed businessman selling a variety of goods as his photo indicates. Among those goods, are included bread, juice, water and cooking oil. His shop is open from 5 am to 9 pm every day.

Cesar has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business by purchasing a large quantity of juice, bread and water, etc., as they are highly in demand.  With this large quantity he will also start a wholesale business. In doing so, Cesar hopes to earn more profits, which will allow him to renovate his supermarket and continue paying school fees for his one relative as well as building a secure future for his own child.

loans.use: To purchase more stock such as juice, bread, and water.

loans.name: Theodole

texts.en:
Theodole is 30 years old and is married with one child who is three years old. Theodole sells clothing in Kabarondo district in Rwanda. This requires him to work hard so that he can provide for his children with all their needs.  Theodole has been working in this business for three years and his store is open from 6am to 7pm every day.

Theodole has requested a loan from Kiva lenders to help expand his business and purchase more clothing to sell.  He hopes this will help increase his profits and allow him to build his own house.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Amigas Group

texts.es:
El comité Amigas del Bº Empalado Ari es un grupo  de señoras que se decidieron formar un comité solidario, cada una con un sentimiento de superación están actualmente en el 7mo ciclo. 
Una de las integrantes es la señora Blanca quien se dedica a la confiteria, ella fabrica masa dulces como media lunas, alfajores, pasta frolas, torta, ademas de otros panificados.
Ella  vende sus productos desde su casa y tambien, distrubueye en algunas despensas del barrio.
Comenta que sus productos son solicitados por los clientes por la buena calida.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de materia prima para la fabricación de comestibles dulces como harina, dulces de guayaba, frutilla, ciruela y otros.
texts.en:
The 'Amigas del Bº Empalado Ari' committee is a group of ladies who decided to create a supportive committee.  Each member feels that they are improving their lives  They are currently in their 7th loan cycle.

One of the members is Blanca who makes confectionery.  She makes sweet pastries such as 'media lunas' (a type of croissant), 'alfajores' (a traditional Arabic confection), 'pasta frolas' (a type of latticed fruit pie), cakes and other baked products..

Blanca sells her products from her home and also delivers them to some neighborhood grocery stores.  She comments that her products are requested by her customers because of their good quality.

Blanca is requesting a loan to buy ingredients for making her sweet pastries such as flour, 'dulces de guayaba' (guava preserve), strawberries, cherries and other products.

loans.use: To buy flour, preserves and other supplies for making confectionery

loans.name: Pius Kiarie

texts.en:
Pius has been practicing dairy farming in Njabini town for the last 6 years. He also acts as a middleman and buys milk from other dairy farmers, which he then sells to the local milk processing farm in bulk.  He is 49 years old, married to Priscilah Wanjira, and they have two children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy more milk for resalel from other dairy farmers and sell it to the local milk processing farm in bulk.

loans.use: To buy more milk for resale from other dairy farmers

loans.name: Joseph Muchiri

texts.en:
Joseph has operated his bread shop for three years in Njabini town.  He is 26 years old and married to Lucy Wangui. They have three children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan to buy more bread to sell to his retail clients.

In the future, Joseph hopes to build his own bakery in Njabini town.

loans.use: To buy more bread to sell.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy O. is 24 years old and is from Manyatta area in Kisumu town. She is a single mother to one daughter named Salonia who is one and half years old.

Nancy has a business selling second-hand clothes and has been in this business for the past year. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD and she intends to use the money to buy more clothes to add to her stock. The profits made from this business will be used to pay nursery school fees for her daughter.

Her dream is to have more stock of clothes to be able to sell in different markets as well as have a clothing stall of her own.

loans.use: Buy more bales of clothes to add to her stock

loans.name: Daniel Ngugi

texts.en:
