Daniel has practiced farming in Njabini town for the last 7 years.  He is 45 years old, married to Josephine Wairimu, and they have 5 children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He repaid his first loan well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy a polythene roll for his greenhouse and a water tank which will allow him to farm using the drip irrigation method.

In future, Stanley hopes to buy more land and practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: To buy a polythene roll for his greenhouse and a water tank

loans.name: Rhoda Kagwira

texts.en:
Rhoda has practiced farming in Njabini town for the last 15 years.  She is 37 years old and a single mother of 2 children.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her second loan.  She repaid her first loan of Kshs 10,000 well and in good time.  She plans to use the current loan amount of Kshs 20,000 to hire land, buy potato seedlings and employ casual workers to plant for her.

In future, Rhoda hopes to buy her own piece of land where she will practice mixed farming.

loans.use: To hire land, buy potato seedlings and employ casual workers to plant for her

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and labor

loans.name: Zouheir

texts.en: Zouheir is a 27 year old married man, father of two kids, working in selling car spare parts and accessories since 2009, he is requesting a loan for the second time from Al Majmoua, in order to increase his capital and improve his business. Zouheir’s main issue is to provide good secure living for his beloved family members; he works hard to provide them with good financial and social situations, in addition to perfect education levels. His clients can be anyone in need of such service; most of them say that his honesty is his positive point and advantage among competitors. He hopes to expand his business in the future with a larger shop and a better living.

loans.use: To increase his capital.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence N. lives in the Kawempe neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school. Florence has a business of selling chickens. She has been in this business for a few months and she works 7 days out of every week. Florence sells her chickens at Kalerwe at the market, by means of retail.

Florence has requested for a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more chickens. The main business challenge(s) for Florence include seasonality, transportation of chickens, and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start raising chickens and also buy a plot of land to build rental rooms. Florence lives in a home that she owns; she doesn't have access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, market dues, and medication.

loans.use: To buy more chickens for resale.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther K. is a lady aged 24 years, married and a mother to only one child who is three years old. Her spouse is called Peter Maina and he works in the motorcycle taxi business.  

Esther runs a retail shop and this has been her business for two years.  She is committed to making the business successful. 

This is the third loan taken out from KADET after repaying the previous loan very well. She will use the borrowed amount to buy: 10 bags of flour, 25 bags of sugar, 10 cartons of cooking fat, and other shop supplies.

She has a desire to add one more motorcycle to her husband's business as he also contributes to the family income. She is therefore working toward this goal and she hopes to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: To buy stock for a general shop

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben is 29 years old and married to Elizabeth. He operates a "Boda boda" transport business using his motorcycle. This is his primary business and he has been doing it for the last three year. 

He got to know about KADET LTD through a KADET staff member. This is his first loan with KADET and he has not borrowed from other financiers before. 

With this loan, Reuben plans to buy spare parts worth Kshs 40,000 and tools worth Kshs 10,000 for repairs. He operates his business in Nzambani which is in Kiwezi town. It has great economic potential and is strategically situated along the Mombasa Nairobi highway.

He desires to start farming using irrigation, and in future, he wants to set up a workshop for assembling motorcycle parts.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts for Kshs 40,000, and Kshs 10,000 to buy tools for repair

loans.name: Majani Ya Chai Group

texts.en:
Rehema M. is in her early twenties and is married with two children. She has been running a charcoal business since 2009. The business is open between 8am and 6pm and earns Rehema a small monthly profit.

This will be Rehema's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. Rehema intends to use this loan to increase her stock of charcoal in order to meet rising demand.

Rehema will share this loan with her loan group, Majani ya Chai (meaning Tea Leaves), which totals 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan. 

In the photograph Rehema can be seen in front carrying a baby.

loans.use: To increase stock of charcoal

loans.name: Jose Isrrael

texts.es:
José Israel, tiene 47 años de edad, reside en Jucuapa, departamento de Usulután, vive con su esposa, dos hijos de 15 y 18 años de edad, ellos dependen aun de sus ingresos, posee un taller de estructuras metálicas, este oficio lo sabía su padre y se lo enseño para que él también se dedicara a este negocio. 
Por el momento el tiene la necesidad de comprar hierro, soldador, alambre y platina por lo que solicita un préstamo para realizar estas compras, ya que estos materiales le son muy necesarios para realizar los trabajos a los clientes.
Sus aspiraciones son con el negocio que sea prospero, que tenga muchos clientes, con sus hijos pues que terminen sus estudios para que mejoren sus  condiciones de vida.
texts.en: José Israel is 47 years old, lives in Jucuapa in the department of Usulután. He lives with his wife and two children, who are 15 and 18 years old. They depend on him for his income. He has a workshop where he produces metallic structure. His father also pursued this profession and taught José so that he could also run the business. At the moment, he needs to buy iron, a soldering iron, wire, and platinum. As a result, he requests a loan to make these purchases, since these materials are necessary to do work for his clients. His dreams for his business are that it’s prosperous and has many clients. He also dreams that his children finish their studies so that they can improve the quality of their lives.

loans.use: To buy iron, a soldering iron, wire, and platinum

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a 29-year-old industrious businessman from Manyatta Estate, a populous low-income estate in Kisumu City, which is situated along the shores of Lake Victoria. Fredrick is married to Judith Nyakiria, a business lady too. The couple has two children aged 6 and 3 years.

Fredrick operates a furniture materials shop in his residential estate of Manyatta. He supplies furniture materials like fiber, blanket waste and sisal fiber to carpenters within his locality. He has been doing this business for the last 10 years. It is through hard work that he is able to make a monthly income of Kshs 20,000. With this determination to excel further, he is taking a second loan, which he will use to purchase sisal fiber and blanket waste to sell. 

Fredrick will use the anticipated profits to educate his children and provide basic necessities like food and clothing. His dream is to one day open a big wholesale shop dealing with sofa set (couch) materials. He also hopes to buy land and build a residential house for his family.

loans.use: To buy furniture materials like sisal fiber and blanket waste to sell

loans.name: Fouzia's Group

texts.en:
Fouzia is a resident of Kamoki, Pakistan, famous for its rice production. She has been living there with her family in a two-room brick house for over five years. Fouzia is a supportive lady. She supports her husband financially by sewing clothes. She sews clothes for her nearby area clients and gets good by completing the sewing orders on time. The earned income helps her to pay the utilities expenses. 

She is the mother of a son and two daughters. Her daughters also help in her business by sewing clothes. Her son is 15 years old and works in a factory for a low income. Fouzia couldn’t educate them due to limited financial resources. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who will use the loan to purchase a buffalo. He is involved in a profession of selling animals. He buys young animals, raises them and then sells then for a good profit. She is hopeful that her husband’s business will grow further by investing the loan money into it and it will result in better financial conditions for her family. She is a new loan user of Asasah and hopes it will be a profitable experience for her. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Fouzia.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for her husband's animal sales business

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
S. Norah lives in the Naguru neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has 6 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (orphans). Norah has a business of selling charcoal and bananas. She has been in this business for 5 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Norah sells her products at the market, by means of retail.

Norah has requested for a loan of 1,200,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal and bunches of bananas. She also generates additional income through rental rooms.The main business challenge(s) for Norah include transportation and the rainy season. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and pay fees for the orphans. Norah lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, monthly market dues, and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal and bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Sandra Lorena

texts.es:
Doña Sandra tiene 45 años de edad, vive en San Carlos, departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catalogo, como AVON, Lorely y otras que dan trabajo a las personas, su familia está conformada por sus padres, su hijo Nelson Mauricio de 17 años, ella sale de su casa a vender todos los días, no tiene un horario fijo para realizar las visitas a los clientes.
Ella quiere comprar productos al catalogo ya que estas temporadas hay muchas ofertas por que quiere adquirirlas y después revenderlas ganándoles un porcentaje,  por lo que solicita un  préstamo para realizar la inversión, con esta oportunidad va a tener variedad de cosméticos para buscarle venta con los clientes.
Su objetivo mayor es trabajar para dar a su hijo los estudios y verlo un profesional para que pueda tener acceso a un buen empleo.
texts.en: Mrs. Sandra is 45 years old. She lives in San Carlos in the department of Morazán, and she sells cosmetics through catalogues, like Avon, Lorely, and others. Her family includes her parents and her son Nelson Mauricio, who is 17 years old. She leaves her house to sell her products every day. She doesn’t have a fixed schedule to visit her clients. She wants to buy products from catalogues because there are many offers during this season. She wants to buy products and then sell them, earning a percentage of the selling price. She is requesting a loan to make this investment, so that she can buy a variety of cosmetics to sell to her clients. Her goal is to work to give her son a good education and to see he become a professional and have a good job.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formo en el Bº San Lorenzo de la Ciudad de Caaguazú, son 16 mujeres independientes en sus trabajos diarios, cada señora tiene un deseo el de progresar, obtenerun apoyo financiero.
Las mismas poseen un gran espiritu emprendedor, trabajan en equipo, se ayudan mutuamente y son un grupo solidario donde la responsabilidad es conjunta y el compromiso es asumido por todas.
Actualmente están en el 6to. Ciclo,  y la presidenta es la Estela.
Ella esta casada y su marido se dedica obrero, y ella para ayudar se dedica a la venta de ropas.
Comenta que quiere tener para esta epoca que se acerca suficiente mercaderías en cuanto a cantidad y calidad de las ropas que quiere ofrecer a sus clientes.
Para concretar la compra de mercaderias como remeras, shorts, vestidos, blusas, y otros.
texts.en:
This committee was formed in the San Lorenzo neighborhood of the city of Caaguazú. They are 16 women who are independent in their daily work. Each of them has the desire to get ahead and obtain help through financing. 

The group members have a strong entrepreneurial spirit, and they work as a team to help each other. It is a group with great solidarity, where responsibility is shared and commitments are taken on by all. Currently, they are in their 6th loan cycle. 

The group's president is Estela. She is married, and her husband is a laborer. For additional support, she works selling clothing. 

She comments that for this season that is approaching, she would like to have enough merchandise to offer clothing to her customers in sufficient quantity and quality.

The loan will be used to buy merchandise such as t-shirts, shorts, dresses, blouses, etc.

loans.use: Buying t-shirts, shorts, blouses, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Reina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Reina, tiene 22 años de edad, vive en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, vende tortillas, su familia la conforma su esposo, sus dos hijos Ever de un año, Keyri de dos años, el negocio lo atiende tres días de la semana en la casa y tres días en el mercado municipal de San Francisco Gotera.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz y leña, ya que son su materia prima para preparar las tortillas, con este préstamo tendrá a disposición mayores recursos para realizar la venta.
Sueña con realizar mucha venta para mejorar su condición económica, y su esperanza es generar lo suficiente para apoyar a sus hijos en los estudios.
texts.en:
Reina is 22 years old and lives in San Francisco Gotera, in the department of Morazán, where she sells tortillas. Her family includes her husband and her two children, Ever, age one, and Keyri, age two. She runs her business three days a week in her home, and three days at the municipal market of San Francisco Gotera.

She is requesting a loan to buy corn and firewood, since these are the raw materials used to prepare tortillas. With this loan, she will have greater resources at her disposal to operate her business.

She dreams of making a great quantity of sales so that she can improve her economic situation. Her hope is to generate sufficient income so that she can support her children's education.

loans.use: Buying corn and firewood

loans.name: Sajida's Group

texts.en:
Sajida lives in Kamoki. It is a small city in Punjab province and known for its rice production. It is also famous for its industrial importance in Pakistan's economy. She lives there with her family in a two-room brick house. She came here after her marriage. Her husband’s name is M. A. and he has a business selling milk.  He has some buffalos at his home that provide a good quantity of milk. The good quantity of milk enables him to serve more customers. 

Sajida herself is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities. In her spare time, she also supports her husband by taking care of his buffalos to give them food and water on time. She is the mother of four sons and a daughter. All of them are illiterate and don’t know how to read or write. Her three elder sons help their father in his business by supplying milk to the customers at their homes.  

Sajida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy another buffalo to further expand his business. The additional buffalo will help him serve many more customers and make more income. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fourth loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.  

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sajida.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for milk selling business

loans.name: C5293 Imboneramurimo Group

texts.en:
Anastase is 33 years old and is married with two children between the ages 8 and 3 years old. Anastase is the leader of this group, called Imboneramurimo. This group contains seven people: three women and four men.

Anastase owns a small shop which sells different kinds of spare parts. Anastase has three years experience and his shop is open from 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. every day.

Anastase and his group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of growing their businesses.  With the loan, Anastase and his group will be able to earn more profits, which will be reinvested in their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase more spare parts.

loans.name: Adnan-Ahmad

texts.en: Adnan-Ahmad is a 47 year old single man from Saida, who has worked as a carpenter for 17 years. He started his own business in January 2010. Adnan-Ahmad is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to buy a car necessary for his work. Adnan-Ahmad is recommended by most of his clients, because his quality of work is more than perfect, and his honesty gives him power among his competitors. Adnan-Ahmad hopes to make a family in the future, for which he’s seeking to ensure a good living.

loans.use: To buy a car necessary for his business.

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
Doña María, resiD. en San Miguel, departamento D. San Miguel, tiene 60 años D. edad, administra una cafetería, vive con  su esposo, tiene tres hijos pero ya están casados y viven con sus familias.
La cafetería la atienD. desD. las 7:00am hasta 5:00pm, a veces hasta más tarD. por los clientes, su experiencia es granD. púes lleva 18 años D. atender el negocio, actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para comprar bebidas refrescantes, boquitas y materiales para panes, hamburguesas, esta inversión ella la quiere realizar porque San Miguel está D. fiesta y mucha gente visita la ciudad,  entonces ella quiere disponer D. materiales para la preparación D. sus ventas y aprovechar para tener ganancia.
Su objetivo es trabajar con fondos propios, espera algún día tener la solvencia económica para realizar sus ventas.
texts.en:
María lives in San Miguel, in the department of the same name. She is 60 years old and runs a cafeteria. She lives with her husband and has three children, but they are already married and live with their own families. 

She works in the cafeteria from 7:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m., or sometimes later for the sake of her customers. She has a great deal of experience, since she has operated the business for 18 years. Currently, she is requesting a loan to buy soft drinks, snacks, and ingredients for rolls, hamburgers, etc. She wants to make this investment because San Miguel is having a festival, and many people are visiting the city. For this reason, she would like to have supplies to prepare for her sales and take advantage of the situation to increase her earnings. 

Her objective is to work with her own funds; she hopes one day to have the economic resources to support her sales.

loans.use: Buying soft drinks and ingredients to make hamburgers

loans.name: C5291 Faith Group

texts.en:
Constasie is 53 years old and is a widow. She is the president of a group called Ibyiringiro which means 'Faith' in english. This group is commonly known for selling a variety of goods such as clothes, foodstuffs, gasoline, etc. 

Constasie and her team are now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to satisfy the demand of their customers which keeps increasing beyond their financial capacity. With the use of this loan, Constasie and her team expect to earn more profits which, in turn, will be used to reinvest in their businesses.

loans.use: To buy a variety of goods such as clothes, foodstuffs etc.

loans.name: Hanifaan's Group

texts.en:
Hanifaan, 51 years old and still very active, is a caring housewife who attends diligently to her household tasks. She is the mother of two sons and three daughters, all of whom study except for the eldest one who works with his father and helps him in his business.

Hanifaan is married to R. A., who operates a Punjabi food restaurant in the market. He offers his customers a variety of tasty Punjabi foods such as Dahi bhalay and potato cutlets along with cold drinks. His good quality food attracts many customers every day.

Hanifaan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband, who will utilize the loan to buy items such as potatoes, yogurt, spices, cooking oil and cold drinks for his restaurant business. Hanifaan is hopeful that a loan investment will enhance his business and result in an increased monthly income.

A regular loan user of Asasah, this will be Hanifaan's fourth loan. With previous loans, she has proven to be a responsible client who always paid her installments on time and attended all meetings.

Note: In the photo, the lady with the book (called Asasah Passbook) is Hanifaan.

loans.use: To buy required items for Punjabi food restaurant business

loans.name: Embajadores 5 Group

texts.en:
Adamilka is the coordinator of her group Embajadores 5 (ambassadors 5). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and 3 children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to give credit to her clients. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying sharing with her family and friends.

Adamilka is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for 6 months, starting with her first loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying toys and women´s accessories. She will use the profits invest in her business and to give her children a good Christmas time.

This Esperanza associate began with us because she wants to make a business and increase their home income, and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industry dominates the economy. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy toys and women's accessories.

loans.name: Keysis Elizabeth

texts.es:
Keysis, es una joven de 22 años de edad, reside en Delicias de Concepción, es soltera y vive con su madre y su hermana, desde hace 6 años se dedica al negocio de las tortillas, su hermana y su madre le ayudan a la preparación de las tortillas y para venderlas ella viaja a Osicala un pueblo cercano, por que este tiene mayor afluencia de gente y es mayor la oportunidad para vender todo, también cuando los vecinos cercanos le buscan les vende.
Ella necesita un préstamo para la compra de maíz y leña, para poder hacer más venta ya que en ocasiones es mucha la demanda.
Su visión es conseguir a través del trabajo de las tortillas la construcción de  su propia casa.
texts.en:
Keysis is a young 22 year-old woman who lives in Delicias de Concepción.  She is single and lives with her mother and sister.  She has been in the tortilla business for 6 years.  Her sister and her mother help her to prepare her tortillas.  She travels to Osicala, a nearby town, to sell them because there are more people in that town and she has a better chance of selling everything.  Her close neighbors often come to buy from her too.

Keysis needs a loan to buy corn and firewood so that she can make more tortillas because there is often a high demand.

Her wish is to build her own home with the profits she makes from her tortilla business.

loans.use: To buy corn and firewood

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José, reside en San Miguel, tiene 44 años de edad, se dedica al comercio en ferias, vive con sus hijos y su esposa, sus hijos tienen 10 y 14 años de edad, su negocio es vender artesanía y juguetes en las ferias de los pueblos cercanos.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería, juguetes y collares, con esta ayuda el podrá tener mejores ingresos para cubrir las necesidades del hogar,  y tendrá mercadería disponible para asistir a más ferias.
Su objetivo es surtir el negocio, salir a vender y regresar a su hogar con ganancias para mejorar así la calidad de vida de su esposa e hijos.
texts.en:
José lives in San Miguel; he is 44 years old and works as a trader at fairs. He lives with his wife and children aged 14 and 10. He sells handicrafts and toys at fairs in nearby towns.

He is currently requesting a loan to buy merchandise, toys and necklaces. With this help he will be able to increase his income to cover household needs, and will have merchandise available to attend more fairs.

His aim is to stock up his business, go out and make sales, and come home with profits in order to improve the quality of life of his wife and children.

loans.use: To buy handicrafts and toys for his business

loans.name: Shaloom Group

texts.en:
Charles L. is in his late twenties and is married with 7-year-old twins. He has been selling women's sandals for 10 years. He works from 10:00 am to 7:00 pm daily and he makes a fair monthly profit.

This will be Charles's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loan to buy more sandals and successfully paid back the loan. He is seeking a new loan to buy more sandals to increase his sales.  His dream is to be a big and popular sandals seller in his area.

Charles will share this loan with his loan group Shaloom, which totals 20 members. The members of this group will hold each other acountable in paying back the loan.

In the picture, Charles is in the back row, fourth from left, wearing a white shirt.

loans.use: To increase stock of sandals

loans.name: Aidah

texts.en:
N. Aidah lives in the Kitawuluzi Rubaga road neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has 6 children, two of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her relatives). Aidah has a business of selling second hand shoes. She has been in this business for 6 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Aidah sells her products door-to-door, by means of retail.

Aidah has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more shoes. She also generates additional income through rental rooms. The main business challenge(s) for Aidah include transportation and the rainy season. Her goals and aspirations for her business are getting a permanent business premise and paying fees for her children. Aidah lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and food.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand shoes.

loans.name: Marvin Roberto

texts.es:
Marvín tiene 42 años de edad, se dedica a la siembra de maíz, frijol, café y hortalizas, vive con su esposa y tres hijos estos estudian, la producción que obtiene la vende en el mercado de San Francisco Gotera, ellos residen en Guatajiagua departamento de Morazán.
Sus padres le enseñaron a realizar los cultivos, y trabaja con la ayuda de mozos, él tiene  experiencia y este trabajo es el que le da los ingresos para mantener a su familia, el único riesgo es el cambio de clima que le afecta la siembra.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de frijol y sembrar, también comprara abono y manguera para regar, esta ayuda le será útil para realizar el cultivo y darle los cuidados necesarios para recibir una buena cosecha.
Sus sueños son que sus hijos puedan ir a la universidad y ser profesionales, por su parte seguirá trabajando para que a su hogar no le falte nada.
texts.en:
Marvín is 42 years old, and he works planting corn, beans, coffee and vegetables. He lives with his wife and his three children, who are in school. He sells the crops he produces at the market in San Francisco Gotera. He and his family live in Guatajiagua, in the department of Morazán.

His parents taught him how to farm, and he works with the help of laborers. He is an experienced farmer, and it is this work that provides the income to support his family. The only risk is the change in climate that affects his crops. 

He is requesting a loan to buy beans to plant; he will also buy fertilizer and a hose for irrigation. This help will be useful to him in growing his crops and providing the necessary care to obtain a good harvest. 

His dreams are that his children will be able to go to the university and become professionals; for his part, he will continue to work so that his household does not lack for anything.

loans.use: Buying beans to plant, fertilizer, and a hose for irrigation

loans.name: Mujeres De Nuevo Renacer 1 Group

texts.en:
Balbina is the coordinator of her group Mujeres de Nuevo Renacer 1 (Women of a new reborn). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and two children. She says that her most difficult challenge is the plan she has to get a divorce. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying sharing with her entire family (parents and others) and cooking.

Balbina is excited to be taking her 6th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for 5 years, starting with a loan she had. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying different beauty and cosmetic products. She will use the profits to buy some medicine for her mother and save because she wants to have a bigger locale for her business. Her goal is to have a bigger salon and a clothing store.
 
This Esperanza associate began with us because she prefer Esperanza's payments and the unity it creates by having group loans, and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Puerto Plata, a port town on the north coast where the economy is based on tourism. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy beauty products and cosmetics.

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en:
Hajara N. lives in the Kawempe Bishop Mukwaya zone neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 5 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her relatives). Hajara has a business of selling bananas. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Hajara sells her products at the market, by means of retail.

Hajara has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more batches of bananas. She also generates additional income through rental rooms and motorcycle for hire. The main business challenge(s) for Hajara include seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and educate her children up to university. Hajara lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication, and food.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Wehbi

texts.en: Wehbi is a 53 year old married man who is a father to six children. He was born, and still lives, in Saida, working in selling fruits and vegetables. Wehbi is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua, in order to register his car which is necessary and helpful to his business. He uses it to go to the market by himself and bring all the things he wants without asking for a taxi to do so and pay extra cash to do so. Wehbi’s work was and still is his main source of living, and it’s the job that raised all his children and drew a path from it for their future. Wehbi hopes to improve his business more, and to have the chance to pilgrim.

loans.use: To register his car necessary for his business.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is 27 years old and is married with one child who is one year old. Nadia's husband is an accountant. Nadia has had her general retail store in the Nyarugenge district of Rwanda for 2 years. She employs 2 people and her store is open from 7 am until 9 pm.  

Nadia has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company so that she can expand her shop by adding a large quantity of goods. These goods will mainly include foodstuffs like juice, notebooks, water, and different types of flour, etc. With these goods, Nadia will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn will allow her to reinvest in her business so that her revenue can keep growing. If successful, Nadia will continue taking care of her children by providing more food for them as well as building a secure future for them.

loans.use: To purchase more juice, water, flour, etc.

loans.name: Obara

texts.en:
Obara is a resident of Kisii Town in Western Kenya. He is married with four children between 13 and 3 years old.  He has been doing mixed farming producing milk, maize, sugar cane and vegetables.

He is challenged by a poor system of road networks and no ready market for his products.

Obara has applied for this loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. He hopes the income generated will enable him to educate his children and give them a better standard of living. He wants to fully rely on his farming income in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Unisi

texts.en:
Unisi N. lives in the Kitawuluzi neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, all of whom are in school.     Unisi has a business of selling new shoes. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Unisi sells her products in the Old tax park in Kampala city by means of retail.

Unisi has requested for a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second hand shoes. The main business challenge(s) for Unisi include the rainy season and ever increasing prices of second hand shoes. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing second hand shoes and also to be a wholesaler. Unisi lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand shoes.

loans.name: Grupo Solidaro Cristal Group

texts.es:
MARIA FLORINDA T. BOROR ES VIUDA  TIENE 3 HIJOS MAYORES YA CASADOS  VIVE EN UNA COMUNIDAD MUY TRANQUILA TIENE 55 AÑOS DE EDAD VIVE EN CASA PROPIA.
DOÑA FLORI VENDE ZAPATOS HACE 35  AÑOS INICIO VENDIENDO ROPA Y ZAPATOS USADOS EN EL MERCADO ANTIGUO DE VILLA NUEVA, ACTUALMENTE VENDE EN UN LOCAL DEL NUEVO MERCADO, VENDE ZAPATOS PARA DAMAS  CABALLEROS Y NIÑOS. DOÑA FLORINDA  SOLICITA UN CREDITO PARA PODER COMPRAR ZAPATOS DE TODA CLASE PO MAYOR YA QUE EN ESTA TEMPORADA TIENE MAS INGRESOS. 
SONIA BRIGGIT  G.  R. TIENE  3  HIJOS UNA MENOR DE 8 AÑOS QUE ESTA EN LA ESCUELA  Y LOS MAYORES QUE AVITAN EN LOS ESTADOS UNIDOS  DESDE HASE 6 AÑOS, ES CASADA Y SU ESPOSO LE AYUDA ECONOMICAMENTE CON LOS GASTOS DE EL HOGAR, ELLA LLEVA 8 AÑOS DE SER COMERCIANTE  PRIMERO INICIO CON VENTA DE COMIDA Y DESPUES VENDIO ROPA USADA  POCO A POCO FUE INCREMENTANDO SUS GANANCIAS Y PUDO ALQUILAR UN LOCAL EN EL MERCADO  DONDE ACTUALMENTE  VENDE PRODUCTOS MEXICANOS   AHORA SOLICITA UN SEGUNDO PRESTAMO PARA COMPRAR MAS MERCADERA YA QUE ESTA ES LA MEJOR TEMPORADA  DE VENTAS PARA ELLA.RIGOBERTO ESTRADA  ES SOLTERO TIENE 25 AÑOS DE EDAD  CON SU MADRE  TIENE  3 HERMANOS YA TODOS SON MAYORES  RIGOBERTO SE  INICIO VENDIENDO ESPECIES  Y LUEGO VENDIO CERAS (VELADORAS, CANDELAS, Y AROMATIZANTES DE TODO TIPO) HACIA SUS REPARTOS EN MOTOCICLETA.ACTUALMENTE TIENE DOS LOCALES EN EL MERCADO  Y VENDE POR MAYOR, RIGOBERTO A TRABAJADO CON FAPE YA 3 AÑOS Y AHORA SOLICIATA UN CREDITO PARA COMPRAR MAS MERCADERIA YA QUE LA QUE TIENE NO LE ALCANZA
texts.en:
Maria Florinda T. Boror is a widow.  She has 3 grown-up children who are already married.  She lives in a very quiet community.  She is 55 years old and lives in her own home.

Doña Flori sells shoes.  She started out selling used clothes and shoes 35 years ago in Villa Nueva's old market.  She currently sells from premises in the new market.  She sells ladies', men's and children's shoes.  Florinda is requesting a loan to buy all kinds of shoes wholesale because she makes more income during this season.

Sonia Briggit G. R. has 3 children; an 8 year-old girl who is in school and two older children who have lived in the United States for 6 years.  Sonia is married and her husband helps her financially with the household expenses.  She has been a saleswoman for 8 years.  She started out selling food and then sold used clothing.  Little by little she increased her profits and was able to rent premises in the market where she currently sells Mexican products.  She is requesting her second loan to buy more merchandise since this is her best sales season.

Rigoberto Estrada is single.  He is 25 years old and lives with his mother.  He has 3 siblings who are all grown up.  Rigoberto started out selling spices and then candles (different types of candles including all kinds of scented candles).  He makes deliveries on his motorbike.  Rigoberto has two premises in the market and sells wholesale.  He has been working with FAPE for 3 years and is requesting a loan so that he can buy merchandise because he doesn't have enough right now.

loans.use: To buy general merchandise, shoes, Mexican products and candles

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Doña Mercedes, reside en San Miguel, departamento de San Miguel, tiene 56 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 20 y 15 años de edad, trabaja de 9:00am a 3:00 pm esta venta es muy buscada por varias personas por lo que para doña Mercedes es rentable y de sus ganancias ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
Ella necesita un préstamo para comprar maíz, por lo que este préstamo le dará la oportunidad de contar con suficiente materia prima para realizar sus ventas, su propósito es salir con la demanda de los clientes y a traer a nuevos a su negocio para ir creciendo poco a poco.
Sueña con ser una gran comerciante, ampliar el negocio y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Mercedes lives in San Miguel, department of San Miguel. She is 56 years old and sells tortillas. She lives with her husband and two children, who are 20 and 15 years old. She works from 9 a.m. until 3 p.m. every day. Her product is very much in demand from several people. For Mercedes it is profitable and her earnings help her husband with the household expenses. 

She needs a loan to buy corn, and this loan will give her the opportunity to have enough raw materials to make her sales. Her motive is to meet her customers' demand and bring new ones to the business so it will grow little by little.
 
She dreams of being a great businesswoman, of growing her business and of helping her family.

loans.use: To buy corn.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert is a father of six and has been doing mixed farming  for four years.  He sells his produce of tea, sugar cane and maize locally.

He has requested this loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says his milk produce will be better and the family will get a good food supplement as well as a source of income to pay his children's fees. He wants to build a business premise in the town as well as improve the quality of his cows for greater production.

Animal diseases coupled with a poor market for the products are his worst challenges.  Gilbert is pleased with Juhudi's loan initiative.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Rafael Gabriel

texts.es:
Rafael de 38 años, es maestro constructor. Vive con su esposa y dos hijos en una zona periurbana con todos los servicios básicos el lugar está ubicado en la Perimetral de Guayaquil zona rodeada de un estero.  

Desde pequeño quiso ser maestro de construcciones debido a la experiencia que tenía como cerrajero pudo poco a poco tener capital para comprar otros materiales que necesitaba para convertirse en maestro constructor. En la actualidad tiene contratos en donde hace trabajos de cerrajería. Trabaja independientemente con sus materiales, desde muy temprano para poder mantener a sus hijos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar materiales de construcción y hierro para hacer más trabajos. En el futuro quiere comprar un carro para mayor facilidad en la movilización.
texts.en: Rafael is 38 years old and is a master builder. He lives with his wife and two children in a suburban area with basic services in an area of Guayaquil surrounded by marshland. Since he was little he wanted to be a master builder, and due to his experience as a locksmith he was able little by little to raise capital to purchase other supplies he needed to become one. Currently, he has some contracts for locksmith work. He works independently with his own supplies from very early in the morning so he can provide for his children. With the loan, he wants to purchase more construction materials and iron in order to do more jobs. In the future he wants to purchase a car so he can move around more easily.

loans.use: Purchase iron and construction materials

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva N. lives in the Kyebando neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, four of whom are in school. Eva has a business of selling fruits and vegetables. She has been in this business for years and she works 6 days out of every week. Eva sells her products in a market by means of retail.

Eva has requested for a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of tomatoes and onions. She gets additional income from rental rooms. The main business challenge(s) for Eva include transportation and perishability. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling on wholesale only and also build more rental rooms. Eva lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of onions and tomatoes.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El grupo se formó en un Barrio denominado Consitución, las mismas son señoras muy humildes, trabajadoras y desean progresar.
Se reunierón asumiendo asi un compromiso y una responsabilidad de retirar préstamo como comité con el fín de ayudarles como una herramienta mas para el trabajo, todas ellas poseen entusiasmo, fuerza y las ganas de trabajar en equipo y asi realizar un pequeño cambio en sus vidas para el progreso de sus familias y de ellas mismas.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Florencia Caceres quien se dedica a la venta de ropas. 
Ella realiza las ventas de sus productos recorriendo las casas de sus clientes.
Actualmente quiere comprar ropas y perfumes para vender.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de remeras, shorts, vestidos, perfumes y otros.
texts.en:
The group was formed in the neighborhood called Consitución. These are humble, hard working women who want to get ahead.  

The got together and made a commitment and took on the responsibility of taking out a loan as a committee with the purpose of helping themselves with this tool for work. All of them are enthusiastic and want to work as a team and thus make a small change i their lives for their families' and their own progress. 

One of the members is Mrs. Florencia Caceres, who sells clothes.  She sells her products to her customers door to door. At present she wants to buy clothes and perfume to sell. She is asking for the loan to buy t-shirts, shorts, dresses, perfume and more.

loans.use: To buy clothes and perfume

loans.name: Eugene

texts.en:
Eugene is 29 years old and he is still single. Eugene has had his business for one year and his store is open from 7 am until 6 pm every day. Eugene owns a small business where he sells shoes. His business is well-known and organized.

Eugene has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business through purchasing more shoes.   

He thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Doña Juana, tiene 57 años D. edad, se dedica a la venta D. tortillas, resiD. en San Miguel, vive con su esposo y su hijo D. 40 años D. edad, este negocio fue fundado por iniciativa propia desD. hace 6 años, los clientes los conforman sus amigos y vecinos cercanos, su esposo la apoya en todo momento.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra D. maíz y leña, pues se le han agotado y es D. vital importancia que no le falten ya que son el principal elemento para la preparación D. las tortillas, con este préstamo ella estará aumentando su inventario y podrá crecer la producción D. las tortillas.
Su objetivo es mantener el negocio estable, seguir trabajando mientras tenga salud, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Doña Juana, 57 years of age, is dedicated to the sale of tortillas.  She lives in San Miguel with her husband and their 40 year-old son.  This business was started 6 years ago on her own initiative.  Her clients are friends and neighbors.  Her husband supports her in everything. 
At this time she requests a loan to buy corn and firewood, because her supply has been exhausted.  It is of vital importance that she not lack for these supplies since they are the main element for the preparation of the tortillas.  With this loan she will grow her inventory and be able to increase production of the tortillas.  
Her objective is to maintain the stable business, to continue working while health permits and to help with the expenses of the home.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood

loans.name: Meshack

texts.en:
Meshack is 37 years old and married, with four children. He has been doing mixed farming for four years, selling his produce of tea, maize, beans and bananas locally.

He has requested this loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the loan will provide milk for family consumption as well as income for basic needs like clothing and school fees.  Meshack is also focusing on purchasing a sewing machine to venture into a tailoring business.

His challenge remains insufficient funds and poor market prices. He says Juhudi's loan initiative has changed lives.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Saidat

texts.en:
Saidat N. lives in the Bwaise neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her in-laws). Saidat has a business of selling second hand clothes. She has been in this business for 7 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Saidat sells her products at the market, by means of retail.

Saidat has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second hand clothes.  The main business challenge(s) for Saidat include seasonality and defaulters. Her goal and aspiration for her business is to start selling wholesale only. Saidat lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand clothes.

loans.name: Zoila Marina

texts.es:
Zoila de 26 años, reside en San Miguel, tiene una venta de frutas y verduras, vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 11 y 6 años de edad, ella junto a su esposo fundaron el negocio de forma ambulante, los clientes residen en algunas colonias que ellos visitan, pero ellos quieren realizar unas compras de mercadería como, frutas manzanas, y verduras como tomates, papas, zanahorias, entre otras que son ofrecidas diariamente a los clientes; Es por este plan de inversión que solicita un préstamo para realizar lo previsto a dar marcha al negocio de una forma más surtida y completa para atender la demanda.
Este préstamo le ayudara a realizar más ventas, ha estabilizar más el negocio y generar ganancias para cubrir sus gastos. Su visión es mantener este negocio por mucho tiempo, innovar cada día para atraer nuevos clientes y que sus hijos puedan prepararse con la educación necesaria para la superación de ellos.
texts.en:
Zoila, age 26, lives in San Miguel.  She has a fruit and vegetable stand.  She lives with her husband and their two children, ages 11 and 6.  She and her husband started the business as traveling street vendors.  Their clients live in some neighborhoods that they visit.  They want to purchase merchandise such as fruits and vegetables like apples, tomatoes, potatoes, and carrots, among others, which they offer daily to their clients.  They request a loan to invest in the purchase of more merchandise to realize their plans to give success to their business by supplying it more and better providing for the demand.
This loan will help them increase their sales, stabilize their business and generate greater profits.  Her vision is to maintain the bussiness for a long time, innovating each day to acquire more clients so that her children can be prepared with an education to improve themselves.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Abel Rodolfo

texts.es:
Abel de 55 años, tiene una panadería y también vende algunos víveres de primera necesidad. Vive en una zona urbana llamada suburbio de Guayaquil y caracterizada porque la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes. 

Hace 10 años atrás tuvo la necesidad de tener un negocio ya que tenía 5 hijos que estaban pequeños, pero como vivía en “Valsar” (un cantón fuera de Guayaquil) no tenía muchas oportunidades de tener su negocio. Cuando sus hijos se graduaron el fue a vivir a Guayaquil y como no encontró trabajo opto por tener su panadería y la surtió con algunos víveres para que sea más atrayentes para las personas. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 16h00 hasta las 17h00 haciendo la masa de los panes y a partir del día siguiente a las 05h30 hasta las 10h00am comienza a vender los panes.   

Con el préstamo quiere comprar harina, manteca para tener la oportunidad de hacer más panes para su negocio. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y mejorar su panadería.
texts.en: Abel is 55 years old and has a bakery where he also sells some groceries of primary need. He lives in a densely populated suburb of Guayaquil where the majority of the inhabitants are merchants. He saw the necessity of having a business 10 years ago because he had five young children, but since he was living in Valsar (a village outside of Guayaquil) he did not have a lot of opportunities. When his children graduated he went to live in Guayaquil and since he couldn't find work he decided to start his bakery and stocked it with some groceries so he could attract more people. He currently works from 4 p.m. to 5 p.m. making dough for his bread and on the following day he starts selling the breads from 5:30 a.m. until 10 a.m. With the loan he wants to purchase flour and lard so he can make more bread for his business. In the future he wants to finish construction on his home and make improvements to his bakery.

loans.use: Flour, lard

loans.name: Perveen Akhter's Group

texts.en:
Perveen Akhter resides in a small city called Kamokay in Pakistan. She lives there with her family in a two-room brick house.  She is a mother of four sons and a daughter. Unfortunately, she couldn’t educate her children due to poor financial conditions. As a result, her elder son works as a laborer while her remaining children don't work. 

Perveen herself is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities.  Her husband is a very hardworking person who has a loading business. He has a donkey cart on which he offers his customers the loading services.
  
Perveen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s loading business. With the loan, he will buy a new donkey cart because his old cart has become rough and rotten in different areas so that he can't fully load it, which is affecting his business.  Perveen is hopeful that by purchasing a new donkey cart her husband will be able to provide better service to his customers and will be able to do his job more efficiently.  

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behaviors and has never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (an Asasah Passbook) is Perveen Akhter.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart

loans.name: Kankélé Group

texts.fr:
Kankélé est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Darsalam de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien. Elles  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 37 ans, sont mariées et mères d’au moins 5 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, les chaussures, les légumes, les habillements, les cosmétiques etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a 2 ans. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de groupe et tous les quatre prêts précédents  ont été bien remboursés. 
Mariam D., qui est la présidente du groupe Kankélé vend de la friperie de draps de lits, d’habits  pour enfants, de pull-overs pour  hommes et femmes etc,  est très sollicitée et appréciée dans la ville de Koutiala.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, une balle de pull-overs surtout en cette période de froid. Elle se procure  de cette balle à Bamako (la capitale malienne).  Elle vend ses articles en détail et au comptant au grand marché de Koutiala et à la maison à une clientèle diverse et variée. 
Tandis que Les membres du groupe Kankélé comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 140 000FCFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle, Mariam D. compte réaliser 160 000FCFA. de bénéfice.
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille. 
Elles souhaitent renforcer leurs partenariats avec Soro Yiriwaso pour pouvoir diversifier leurs marchandises.
texts.en:
Kankélé is a group of women from the Darsalam neighborhood of Koutiala who know each other well.  They live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other relatives.  They have an average age of 37 and are married with at least 5 children.

This group of women sells various articles such as shoes, vegetables, clothing, cosmetics, etc.  To increase the scale of their business, the members decided two years ago to participate in the Soro Yiriwaso credit program.  They are on their fifth group loan and all four of the previous loans have been repaid.

Mariam D., the president of the Kankélé group, sells secondhand sheets, children's clothing, men's and women's sweaters, etc.  She is very popular and appreciated in the village of Koutiala.  She plans to use her loan to purchase a bale of sweaters for the current colder period.  She will obtain the bale in Bamako, the capital.  She sells these products on a retail and credit basis in the Koutiala market and at home to a diverse clientele.  While the members of the Kankélé group expect to make an average profit of 140,000FCFA each during this cycle, Mariam D. expects to make a profit of 160,000FCFA.

Besides repaying the loans, the women use a part of the revenue to meet family expenses.  They wish to strengthen their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso in order to diversify their products.

loans.use: Purchase of secondhand clothing

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Abel is a resident of Kisii Town in western Kenya, where he has been doing mixed farming and selling his produce of bananas, maize, beans and milk. He has been in farming for 25 years.

He has requested this loan of 35,000 Kenyan shillings through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He believes this will be a good and stable source of milk for family consumption and income for the children's education fees.

His major challenges are animal diseases, a poor market for the products and hostile weather conditions at times. He is very appreciative to Juhudi for the loan service.

loans.use: Purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Yeraldy

texts.es: La Sra. Yeraldy se dedica al comercio de edredones, juegos de olla, vajillas y otros desde hace tres años; generalmente deja la mercadería a crédito y posteriormente realiza los cobros de manera semanal, debido a que la mayoría de su capital esta en las cuentas por cobrar y se acercan las fiestas de fin de año necesita capital para comprar mercadería, razon por la cual solicito el credito, la venta es de forma ambulante a personas ya conocidas por ella, también ofrece en los mercados a personas que tienen puestos fijos para así poder cobrar  sin ningún problema, la Sra. Yeraldy es una persona muy trabajadora y esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Señora Yeraldy has been dedicated to the sale of comforters, pots & pans, dishes and other things for three years.  Generally she sells the merchandise on credit and subsequently carries out the collections weekly.  Since the majority of her capital is tied up in her accounts receivable and the year end festivals are approaching, she needs capital to buy merchandise.  For this reason she requests a loan.  Her sales are performed door-to-door to people already known to her.  She also offers her merchandise in the markets to people that have stalls in order to be able to charge with no problem.  Señora  Yeraldy is a very hard-working person and is very thankful to the institution for the support offered.

loans.use: to buy a variety of merchandise for resale

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz lives in Kamoki, which is a small city in Punjab Pakistan known for its rice production. She lives in the area named Chungi no.7 with her family in a 2 room brick house. She moved here many years ago with her family. 

Shahnaz is 46 years old, married to A. A. and has 4 children: 2 daughters and 2 sons. Her children couldn’t get an education due to financial reasons and started working in their teens. Her both sons work in the local factory. Her husband is a driver by profession and drives a rickshaw. With this rickshaw, he provides transport services to passengers. 

Shahnaz herself is a very supportive lady by nature. She supports her family financially by doing embroidery work. She is a very talented embroidery artist and receives regular orders every month from her neighborhood clients. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her embroidery business. With the loan, she will buy clothes and embroidery material such as beads, colored thread and sketches in bulk quantity. That will help her finishing orders on time and offer more embroider variety to her clients. 

She hopes that an investment will bring positive changes to her business and she will increase her household income. She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application.  

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shahnaz.

loans.use: To buy clothes and  material for an embroidery business

loans.name: Doris Gabriela

texts.es:
Doris Gabriela B. M. tiene 20 años. Vive en Unión Libre  vive con el compañero y los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos.
 
Los miembros de la V.R.C. El LA UNION se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Aguas Frías, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Doris se dedica a la agricultura especialmente ala siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 2 años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y los vende en la feria de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener dinero para la educación de sus hijos y construir la casa.
Le gusta hacer deporte salir a caminar con la familia
texts.en:
Doris Gabriela B. M. is 20 years of age.  She lives in Unión Libre with her companion and children.  She lives in the Ventanas canton in the Province of Los Ríos. She has 2 children.
 
The members of the V.R.C. El LA UNION are found in the Aguas Frías region, belonging to the Ventanas canton.  This branch is dedicated to agricultural workers who grow crops with a short growing cycle such as corn, rice and beans.  This activity requires a great deal of time.  

Doris has been dedicated to agriculture, especially the growing of corn, rice and beans for 2 years.  She buys her products in Ventanas and sells them in the Ventanas market and in the same area.  

She requests the loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizer for her crops.  The support of the loan will help her economically to supply her needs.  She faces challenges such as plagues, diseases and changes in the climate.  Her dream is to have money for the education of her children and to build a house.  She likes to play sports and go for walks with the family.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies and fertilizer for the cultivations.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for a hydroponic greenhouse.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: El Sr. Pedro, vive la zona de Larati centro a  45 minutos de la localidad de Sacaba, tiene terrenos para sembrar papa , habas ,   el se dedica a la venta de papa por cargas  en Cochabamba en el mercado,  Es muy responsable en su trabajo y tiene mucha experiencia ya que es una familia de agricultores , el Sr. Pedro  augura buenas cosechas  para diciembre,  el préstamo lo destinara para la compra de material de construcción de su casa , como don pedro también  es albañil el mismo realizara la construcción .su esposa se dedica a la venta de verduras en el mercado, actividad donde le va muy bien,  sus hijos son ya independientes, el Sr.  Esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Señor Pedro lives in the Larati central zone located 45 minutes from the locality of Sacaba.  He has fields for growing potatos and beans.  He is dedicated to the sale of potatoes by the load in the Cochabamba market.  He is very responsible in his work and has much experience, since he comes from an agricultural family. Señor Pedro foretells good crops for December.  The loan is destined for the purchase of building material for his house, as Señor Pedro is also a bricklayer.  He does the construction himself.  His wife is dedicated to the sale of vegetables in the market, an activity where she does very well.  Their children are already independent.  He is thankful to the institution for the support offered.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
62 year old Doris hails from Kisii Town in Western Kenya. She has been doing mixed farming for 30 years, selling her produce of milk, beans, potatoes, vegetables and tea to the local market and government.

She has requested this loan of 45,000 KES to purchase and feed a dairy cow.She hopes the income generated will enable her put up a business premise.The added milk she will be a source of family food too. She is planning to have five dairy cows of good quality and purchase land for farming.

Her challenges remain price fluctuation and animal diseases.

loans.use: Purchase and maintain a dairy cow

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah N. lives in the Nabulagala neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, all of whom are in school.  Sarah has a business of selling second hand clothes. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Sarah sells her products at the market, by means of retail.

Sarah has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more clothes. The main business challenge(s) for Sarah include transportation and ever increasing prices of second hand clothes. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only and also to build her own business premises. Sarah lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand clothes.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Maria Auxiliadora C. Y. tiene 33 años. Vive en Unión Libre  vive con el compañero y los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 5 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. El LA UNION se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Aguas Frías, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Maria se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 5 años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y los vende en la feria de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es incrementar el negocio para tener dinero para educar a los hijos.

Le gusta salir a pasear todos los domingos con la familia.
texts.en:
Maria Auxiliadora C. Y. is 33 years of age.  She lives in Unión Libre with her companion and children.  She lives in the Ventanas canton in the Province of Los Ríos. She has 5 children.
 
The members of the V.R.C. El LA UNION are found in the Aguas Frías region, belonging to the Ventanas canton.  This branch is dedicated to agricultural workers who grow crops with a short growing cycle such as corn, rice and beans.  This activity requires a great deal of time.  

Doris has been dedicated to agriculture, especially the growing of corn, rice and beans for 5 years.  She buys her products in Ventanas and sells them in the Ventanas market and in the same area.  

She requests the loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizer for her crops.  The support of the loan will help her economically to supply her needs.  She faces challenges such as plagues, diseases and changes in the climate.  Her dream is to grow her business in order to have money for the education of her children.  She likes to go for a walk every Sunday with the family

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Fatima Maribel

texts.es:
Fatima Maribel V. A. tiene 23 años. Vive en Unión Libre  vive con el compañero y los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos.
 
Los miembros de la V.R.C. El LA UNION se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Aguas Frías, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Fatima se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 5 años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y los vende en la feria de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es dar la educación a los hijos.
Le gusta salir a pasear todos los domingos con la familia.
texts.en:
Fatima Maribel V. A. is 23 years of age.  She lives in Unión Libre with her companion and children.  They live in the Ventanas canton in the Province of Los Ríos. She has 2 children.
 
The members of the V.R.C. El LA UNION are found in the Aguas Frías region, belonging to the Ventanas canton.  This branch is dedicated to agricultural workers who grow crops with a short growing cycle such as corn, rice and beans.  This activity requires a great deal of time.

Fatima has been dedicated to agriculture especially to the sowing of corn, rice and beans for 5 years.  She buys her products in Ventanas and sells them in the Ventanas market and in the same precinct.  

She requests the loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers for the cultivations.  The support of the loan would help her economically to supply her needs.  She faces challenges such as plagues and illnesses and the changes in the climate.  Her dream is to give an education to her children.  She likes to go for a walk on Sundays with the family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers for the cultivations

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Mujeres De Negocio Group

texts.es:
GRUPO SOLIDARIO MUJERES DE NEGOCIO

Esta conformado por 3 señoras ,Ana Dela B.  C.  de 34 años, que inicio su negocio desde hace 15  con la ayuda de su mama vendiendo primero Ropa Típica  Luego su hermana  le animo a vender productos por catalogo   ya que ella conocía a sus clientes  y así mismo pudo invertir   	mas en su negocio y colocar su venta en su casa  es una mujer separada que ha salido a delante con la ayuda de su negocio  su familia esta integrada por 4 personas 3 menores de edad que siguen estudiando en la escuela local 1 mayor de edad que le ayuda  a vender los productos solicita este crédito para compra de productos por catalogo y darles una vida digna a su familia, Guadalupe C.  G. una señora  de 59 años de edad con deseos de seguir adelante  en su negocio  y así mismo poder ayudar en algunas cosas a sus hijos que son ya independientes, solicita este crédito para comprar mas variedad de ropa. Julieta C. B.  de 26 años se dedica a la venta de productos por catalogo y varia por cada temporada  productos, tiene 1 hija menor de edad vende en su casa  es madre soltera, desea este crédito para comprar productos por catalogo y así mismo poder darle  a su hija lo indispensable  y poder ensañarle que una persona puede salir adelante no importando obstáculos.
texts.en:
Solidarity Women of Business Group is comprised of 3 women.  
Ana Dela B.  C., age 34, who started her business 15 years ago with the help of her mother selling primarily Traditional Clothing.  Later her sister helped her begin selling products from catalogs, since she knew her clients.  In this same way she could invest more in her business and locate her store in her house.  She is a separated woman that has moved ahead with the aid of her business.  Her family is comprised of 4 people; 3 under age who continue studying in the local school and 1 of legal age that helps to sell the products.  She requests this loan to purchase products from catalogs and to give a worthy life to her family.  
Guadalupe C. G. is a 59-year-old lady with desires to move her business ahead and thus be able to help in some things for her children that are already independent.  She requests this loan to buy a greater variety of clothes.  
July C. B., age 26 years, is dedicated to the sale of products by catalog and various seasonal products.  She has 1 daughter who is under age.  She sells in her house and is a single mother.  She desires this loan to buy products from catalogs and thus to be able to give her daughter the indispensable things and to be able to teach her that a person can do well despite obstacles.

loans.use: to buy clothing and products from catalogs

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Con Proposito 4 Group

texts.en:
Marlenis is the coordinator of her group Mujeres Unidas con Proposito 4 (Unite Women with purpose). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and a child. She says that her most difficult challenge is to attend to university. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying to watch television and listen to music.

Marlenis is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. She is starting her business with this loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying clothes, shoes and accessories. She will use the profits to re-invest in her business. She dreams of finishing her university, becoming a professional, and help her family and others. 

This Esperanza associate began with us because she was interested in starting a business and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production, and the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy clothes, shoes and accessories.

loans.name: Mariana Del Rocio

texts.es:
Mariana Del Rocio C. I. tiene 39 años. Vive en Unión Libre  vive con el compañero y los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos.
 
Los miembros de la V.R.C. El LA UNION se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Aguas Frías, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Mariana se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 14 años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y los vende en la feria de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es aumentar sus cultivos y comprar un tractor.

Le gusta limpiar la casa y ayudar en las tareas a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mariana Del Rocio C. I. is 39 years old.  She lives in Unión Libre  with her partner and two children in the canton of Ventanas in the Los Rios province.

The members of V.R.C. El LA UNION are located in the Aguas Frias area, which is in the canton of Ventanas.  This group does short-cycle agricultural work growing corn, rice, and beans. They have been doing this for a long time.

Mariana has worked in agriculture, growing corn, rice, and beans, for the past 14 years.  She buys her products in Ventanas and sells her crops at the fair in Ventanas and her local neighborhood.

She is asking for a loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers for her crops.  The loan will help her economically so she can provide for her personal and family needs.  Mariana faces challenges like plagues, sicknesses, and variable climate.  Her dream is to grow her crops and buy a tractor.

She likes to clean her house and help her children with their schoolwork.

loans.use: Buying agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es:
Martha Cecilia I. V. tiene 22 años. Vive en Unión Libre  vive con el compañero y los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. El LA UNION se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Aguas Frías, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Martha se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 14 años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y los vende en la feria de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una casa grande.
Le gusta ir los domingos a caminar con la familia.
texts.en:
Martha Cecilia I. V. is 22 years. She lives in Unión Libra in the district of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos with her partner and their three children.

The members of the V.R.C La Union (the Union Community Bank) are located in the Aguas Frías area, in the district of Ventanas, and they pursue short-cycle agricultural work. They harvest corn, rice, and beans, and they spend a lot of time doing this.

Martha has pursued agriculture, especially growing corn, rice, and beans, for 14 years. She buys her inputs in Ventanas and sells them in the Ventanas market in her area.

She is requesting this loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers for her crops. The support from the loan will help her financially to buy the necessary goods. She faces obstacles like plagues, illnesses, and variation in the climate. Her dream is to buy a large house. She enjoys going on walks with her family on Sundays.

loans.use: Agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine N. lives in the Nakulabye neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 2 children, one of whom is in school. Christine has a business of selling second hand shoes. She has been in this business for less than one year, and she works 6 days out of every week. Christine sells her products at the market, by means of retail.

Christine has requested for a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second hand shoes. The main business challenge(s) for Christine include seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are expanding her business. Christine lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent, and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand shoes.

loans.name: Elsi Varinia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LLANKACHINAPAC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elsi; ella tiene 35 años de edad, casada  y tiene 2 hijos; La socia tiene su negocio de venta de productos de golosinas como galletas,dulces,bebidas gasificadas (gaseosas, agua mineral),chocolates entre otros mas, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en el terminal de Urubamba, la socia trabaja todos los días y de esta forma saca a su familia adelante. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más mercadería para su negocio.
