To make a living, Melvien owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling cosmetics from NATASHA & AVON in the local community. Melvien has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Melvien joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Melvien has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Melvien is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Melvien from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products for sale

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
Enrique es un padre de familia de 30 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a su menor hijo en el sector Bodegones, una zona rural del distrito de Lambayeque, se encuentra ubicada a más de media hora de la ciudad Chiclayo.

El cuenta con un terreno de cultivo en donde suele sembrar alfalfa la cual comercializa entre sus vecinos y publico en general de la zona, ya que usualmente se dedican a la crianza y comercialización de animales y usan estas plantas como alimento para sus animales. Debido al tiempo que tiene trabajando en esta actividad el se ha vuelto bastante conocido en el rubro y actualmente cuenta con un grupo de clientes fidelizados.

Enrique desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de algunos fertilizantes que tiene pensado aplicar en su cultivo para garantizarse una buena producción, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

El es una persona bastante responsable y trabajadora. Las personas que le conocen le consideran un padre entregado a su familia de que siempre ayuda cuando se le necesita.
texts.en:
Enrique is a 30 year old father who lives with his wife and young son in the Bodegones sector, a rural zone in the Lambayeque district, located more than 30 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

He has some farmland where he raises alfalfa and sells to his neighbors and to the general public within the zone.  His customers use these plants as feed for their livestock.  Because of the length of time he has been doing this, he has become very well known in the field and has regular customers.

Enrique would like to expand his business and wants to buy fertilizer so that he can improve his production, so he has seen fit to request a loan for 800 PEN ($300) through Edpyme Alternativa, in order to reach his objective.

He is a very hard working and responsible person and those who know him consider him to a dedicated family man who always helps out when he is needed.

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Charlyn

texts.en:
Charlyn M. is from the village of Thailand, Banisilan, Cotabato. She is 41 years old. Charlyn is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Charlyn owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. This is not the only means for generating revenue, as the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, beverages, instant noodles & breads in the local community. Charlyn has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Charlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and the ability to engage in business activities. Charlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Charlyn is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Charlyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Genara

texts.es:
Genara tiene 61 años D. edad, es casada y resiD. junto a su familia en el distrito D. Ciudad Eten, una zona ubicada a media hora D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo y conocida por la calidad D. los sombreros y artículos elaborados artesanalmente a base D. junco que son fabricados por sus tejedoras.

Ella cuenta con un puesto D. venta en el mercado del distrito donD. resiD., allí ofrece en venta al público en general prendas D. vestir y diversos artículos como locería y adornos. El negocio ya cuenta con una antigüedad D. 12 años y debido a ello actualmente cuenta con una clientela fidelizada. Genara se vale D. el para sacar adelante a su familia.

Ella desea adquirir más mercadería para poder responder a la demanda que suele aumentar por temporada naviD.ña. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad D. solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles.

Genara es una mujer D. trato amable y bastante respetada por sus vecinos y clientes, los cuales la consideran una mujer tranquila y que gusta mucho D. ayudar a quienes le necesitan.
texts.en:
Genara is 61 years old.  She is married and lives with her family in the Ciudad Eten district, a zone located 30 minutes from the city of Chiclayo and known for the good quality of hats and crafts maD. from a variety of materials, sewn together by artisans.

She has a stall in the district marketplace, where she sells general clothing, clay crafts and decoration to the general public.  She has had this business for 12 years and has regular customers.  Genara values this business because it allows her to get her family ahead.

She would like to acquire more merchandise in order to be able to meet the demand that goes up over the Christmas holidays, so she has seen fit to request a 2,000 PEN ($725) loan through Edpyme Alternativa.

Genera is a friendly woman who is well respected by her neighbors and customers, who all consider her to be a calm woman who likes helping those in need.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen B. is from the village of Fatima, Liloy, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is 51 years old. Helen is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Helen owns and operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Helen has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 20000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Helen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fish to raise. Helen is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to raise. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Helen from PMPC although the first one was not funded by Kiva. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to raise

loans.name: Carmen Erlita

texts.es:
Erlita es una madre de familia de 36 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito de Pacasmayo, una zona bastante comercial que pertenece a la provincia del mismo nombre y que se encuentra ubicado en la región La Libertad, a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Erlita cuenta con un puesto de venta de verduras en el mercado del distrito de Pacasmayo, ella ya lleva más de quince años trabajando en este rubro y debido a ello se ha hecho conocida y tiene una clientela fija que prefiere su negocio por la calidad de atención que brinda. Actualmente ella desea incrementar su inventario de productos para responder de mejor modo a la demanda que posee, por ello ha decidido solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer que gusta de mucho de la labor que realiza ya que le hace sentirse activa y porque también gracias a ella puede ayudar a su familia a solventar sus gastos económicos diariamente. Su mas grande deseo es verlos progresar y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Erlita is a 36-year-old mother who lives with her husband and her children in the Pacasmayo district, a commercial zone in the Pacasmayo province, La Libertad region, more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.  She has a vegetable stand in the Pacasmayo market, and has already spent more than 15 years working in this area. As a result, she is well known with a steady clientele who prefer her business because of the quality of service she provides.  She is a woman who likes work that makes her feel active.  Thanks to this, she can help her family pay their daily expenses.  Her greatest wish is to see her family progress and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: To increase vegetable stand inventory

loans.name: Juan De Dios

texts.es:
Juan de Dios tiene 66 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Pacasmayo, una zona con bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra ubicada en la región La Libertad, a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

El cuenta con una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí el ofrece en venta a sus vecinos diversos productos de consumo diario entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con una antigüedad de 25 años y actualmente cuenta con una clientela fija y fidelizada. Gracias a esta actividad el ha podido mantener a su familia y sacarla adelante durante todo este tiempo.

Juan de Dios desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes durante la temporada de navidad, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Juan de Dios is 66 years old, married and lives with his family in the Pacasmayo district, a fairly commercial zone located in the La Libertad region, more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region.  

He owns a bodega that he runs out of his home.  He sells a diverse range of everyday products along with essential necessities and groceries.  The business is 25-years-old and has a loyal and steady clientele.  Thanks to this, he has been able to provide for his family and give them a good start in life during this time.  

Juan de Dios wants to expand his business by buying more merchandise to satisfy demand during the holiday season.  For this reason, he has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a $375 loan.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise and expand his business.

loans.name: Angel Pablo

texts.es:
Angel es un padre de familia de 57 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en el pueblo joven San Martín una zona urbano – marginal del distrito de Lambayeque, ubicado a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Trabaja como chofer en una combi que cubre las rutas Chiclayo – Lambayeque y viceversa desde hace 20 años. Este negocio ha sido su fuente de sustento durante todo este tiempo y con ella ha sacado adelante a su familia. Su rutina empieza desde las 5 am y termina a las 10pm.

Angel desea realizar algunas reparaciones en el vehículo que utiliza para ganarse el sustento, ya que este ha empezado a sufrir algunas fallas, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.

Angel es una persona alegre, carismática y muy trabajadora. El ya ha tenido un préstamo financiado por el Fondo Kiva brindado por Edpyme Alternativa a través de su producto Capital Semilla, con este crédito el realizó algunas mejoras en la infraestructura de su vivienda, por lo que se encuentra muy agradecido con cada uno de los prestamistas de Kiva que le ayudaron a realizar esta acción.
texts.en:
Angel is 57-year-old father who lives with his wife and three children in the town of San Martin, an new urban zone outside of the Lambayque distribution and 20 minutes form the city of Chiclayo.  

For twenty years, he has worked as a van chauffer that covers the Chiclayo – Lambayeque routes and back.  This business has been his primary source of support over the years, and as a result he has been able to give his family a good start in life.  His routine begins at 5am and ends at 10pm.  

Angel wants to make some repairs on his vehicle since it has begun to have some problems.  Therefore, he has asked Edpyme Alternative for a $550 loan to achieve his goal. 

Angel is a happy, charismatic person and a very hard worker.  He previously had a loan financed by Kiva and provided by Edpyme Alternativa through Capital Semilla.  With this loan he made some improvements on his home.  He is very grateful for each of the loans from Kiva that help him achieve his goal.

loans.use: To repair vehicle.

loans.name: Maria Yeny

texts.es:
María Yeny tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene carga familiar. Reside junto a sus padres en el caserío La Ollerría, una zona rural del distrito de Mórrope que se encuentra ubicada a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

María cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio, allí ella ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos de uso diario entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes, los cuales son de mucha utilidad ya que su comunidad se encuentra ubicada a varios kilómetros de distancia del pueblo de Mórrope. Paralelamente se encarga de ofrecer el servicio de peluquería entre los vecinos y vecinas de la zona. María se vale de estas actividades para solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar a su familia en el sostenimiento de su economía diaria.

María desea adquirir mas productos para poder implementar su bodega ya que debido a la cercanía de la temporada navideña sus ventas suelen aumentar, asimismo desea ampliar su peluquería con la compra de algunos implementos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
María Yeny is a 24-year-old single woman without children.  She lives with her parents in the town of La Ollerría, a rural zone in the district of Mórrope located more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo.  

María runs a small convenience store out of her home.  There, she offers her customers a diverse range of everyday products, basic necessities, and groceries, all of which are very useful since her community is located quite a few kilometers from the town of Mórrope.  She also works as a beautician for her neighbors in town.  María uses these jobs to pay for her personal expenses and to help her family with their daily expenses.  

María wants to acquire more products to stock her store since the holidays are approaching and her sales usually increase.  Also, she wants to expand her beauty salon by buying some hairdressing tools.  Therefore, she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of $375.

loans.use: To acquire more products to stock her convenience store.

loans.name: Ruth Petronila

texts.es:
Ruth tiene 29 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a sus padres en el distrito de Mochumí, una zona agrícola de regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra ubicada a más de media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella cría aves domésticas en algunos corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, cuando estas ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde reside. Con las ganancias que percibe de esta actividad ella se encarga de solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar al desarrollo económico de su familia.

Ruth desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más animales, alimento balanceado y mejorando sus corrales, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Su mas grande deseo es que su negocio siga creciendo para poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Ella gusta mucho de la labor que realiza y siempre se esmera para poder mantenerla y sacarla adelante.
texts.en:
Ruth is 29 years old and single. She lives with her parents in the district of Mochumí, an agricultural zone with regular commercial activity, located more than half an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

She raises domestic birds in several enclosures located behind her house. When they have reached a good level of development, she offers them for sale to the buyers who regularly visit the area where she lives. With the earnings she receives from this activity, she takes charge of paying her personal expenses and also supports her family's economic development. 

Ruth would like to expand her business by acquiring more animals and nutritionally balanced feed, and also improving her enclosures. For this reason, she has decided to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 Peruvian new soles.

Her greatest desire is to see her business continue to grow, so that she can provide her family with a better quality of life. She enjoys her work very much, and she is always working hard to maintain and advance her business.

loans.use: Acquiring more animals and feed and improving her enclosures

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula tiene 38 años D. edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos, resiD. junto a su familia en un sector urbano marginal del distrito D. Lambayeque, una zona D. movimiento comercial considerable que se ubica a veinte minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Paula cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio, allí ella ofrece a sus vecinos diversos productos D. consumo diario, entre productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes. Su negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida por parte D. los pobladores D. la zona ya que se encuentra ubicada lejos del centro D. la ciudad. Con los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad ella ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento D. la economía familiar.

Ella desea adquirir mas productos para ampliar su negocio con motivo D. la cercanía D. las fiestas naviD.ñas ya que durante esta temporada la demanda por sus productos aumenta. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Paula, 38, is married and has three children.  She lives with her family in a marginal urban sector of Lambayeque district, an area with considerable commercial activity located twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Paula has a small grocery store installed in her house where she offers her neighbors various daily use items among which are first need items and groceries.  Her business is well received by residents of the area because it is located far from city center.  Income from this activity makes it possible for her to help her husband support the family.

She wants to acquire more products to expand her store due to the approaching Christmas season because this is when demand increases.  She has, therefore, asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan to help her reach this objective.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina tiene 44 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su familia en campiña Laynas, una zona rural del distrito de La Matanza, una zona que pertenece a la provincia de Morropón y que se encuentra ubicada en la región Piura a más de dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Marina cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio, allí ella ofrece a sus vecinos diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. Su negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida por parte de los pobladores de la zona ya que se encuentra ubicada lejos del centro de la ciudad por ser zona rural. Con los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad ella ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía familiar.

Ella desea adquirir mas productos para ampliar su negocio con motivo de la cercanía de las fiestas navideñas ya que durante esta temporada la demanda por sus productos aumenta. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Marina, 44, is married and lives with her family in Laynas, a rural area of La Matanza district that is part of Morropón district in Piura region over two and a half hours away from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital.

Marina has a small grocery store installed in her home where she stocks various daily consumption items among which are first need items and groceries.  Her business is well received by residents in the area because it is far from city center since it’s a rural zone.  Income from this activity helps her husband support the family economy.

She wants to acquire more products to widen her stock because of the approaching 
Christmas season which is when demand for products increases.  She has, therefore, deemed it advisable to request a 2000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa that will help her reach her goal.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Gregorio tiene 33 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su familia en el caserío Carrasquillo del distrito de Buenos Aires, ubicado en la provincia de Morropón, región Piura este distrito esta situado a más de dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

El cuenta con una pequeña parcela de cultivo en donde suele sembrar maíz, el ya tiene más de 10 años en este negocio y durante todo este tiempo se ha valido de esta actividad para sacar adelante a su familia. Gregorio gusta mucho de su trabajo y debido al tiempo que lleva laborando en esta actividad el conoce bastante del manejo de cultivos.

Gregorio desea brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de maíz, por ello ha creído conveniente comprar algunos fertilizantes, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Gregorio, 33, is married and lives with his family in Carrasquillo, Buenos Aires district, located in Morropón province, Piura region, more than two and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital.

He has a small field where he grows corn.  He’s been in this business for over 10 years and all this time he has relied on it to support his family.  Gregorio enjoys his work very much and due to the length of time he’s been doing this work he has become quite knowledgeable about crop care.

He wants to provide maintenance for his corn crops so he needs to buy some fertilizers.  To reach his goal he has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his corn crops.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 49 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su familia en el caserío Calera Santa Rosa del distrito de Olmos, ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, la zona está situada a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El cuenta con una pequeña parcela de cultivo en donde suele sembrar maracuyá, el ya tiene más de 14 años en este negocio y durante todo este tiempo se ha valido de esta actividad para sacar adelante a su familia. Pedro gusta mucho de su trabajo y debido al tiempo que lleva laborando en esta actividad el  conoce bastante del manejo de cultivos.

El desea brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo, por ello ha creído conveniente comprar algunos fertilizantes, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Pedro, 49, is married and lives with his family in Calera Santa Rosa, Olmos district, located in Lambayeque province over two hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

He has a small field where he grows passion fruit.  He’s been in this business for over 14 years and all this time he has relied on this activity to support his family.  Pedro enjoys his work very much and due to the length of time he’s been doing this work he is quite knowledgeable about crop care.

He wants to provide maintenance to his crops so needs to buy some fertilizers.  To reach this goal he has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his passion fruit crops.

loans.name: Rosa Dolores

texts.es:
Rosa es una madre de familia de 53 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Motupe, una zona conocida por sus festividades religiosas que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con un pequeño establecimiento ubicado en el centro de su domicilio en donde suele ofrecer en venta ropa y calzado para todo público. Como ya cuenta con varios años de experiencia su establecimiento es uno de los más conocidos de la zona. Ella se ha valido de este negocio para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Rosa desea adquirir más mercadería con motivo de la proximidad de las fiestas navideñas, ya que la demanda durante esta temporada suele aumentar, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Rosa es bastante conocida en la zona por su buen carácter y porque siempre gusta de ayudar a los demás. Ella es muy querida y estimada por sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Rosa, 53, is a mother living with her family in Motupe, an area known for its religious festivals, located in Lambayeque province over an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

She has a small establishment in her home where she sells clothes and shoes to the general public.  Since she already has several years experience, her establishment is one of the better known ones in the area.  She has relied on this business to help her husband support the family’s economy.

Rosa wants to acquire more merchandise due to the approaching Christmas festivities because this is when demand rises.  She has, therefore, asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan.

Rosa is quite well known in her area due to her good character and because she always likes to help others.  She is very loved and esteemed by her neighbors.

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Fredesman

texts.es:
Fredesman es un padre de familia de 32 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en el caserío Hualtaco del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores y aves de corral, el cría gallinas, patos, pavos y gallinas en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Adicionalmente trabaja como agricultor.

El desea adquirir alimentos para sus aves ya que la demanda aumenta durante la temporada navideña, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Fredesman es un padre bastante entregado a su familia y que siempre vela por su bienestar y desarrollo. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Fredesman, 32, is a father living with his wife and two children in Hualtaco, part of the agricultural Tambogrande district, an agricultural area located in Piura region more than four hours from Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region.

He raises small farm animals and barnyard fowl.  He raises chickens, ducks, and turkeys in his back yard and when they reach a proper level of growth he sells them to merchants who visit his place of residence.  He also works as a farmer.

He wants to acquire feed for his fowl because demand for them rises during the Christmas season.  He has, therefore, asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 500 new sol loan.

Fredesman is a father who is quite devoted to his family and is always watchful of their wellbeing and development.  People who know him hold him in high esteem and affection.

loans.use: To buy fowl feed.

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
Rosa es una madre de familia de 32 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola de la región Piura que se encuentra ubicada a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio en donde suele ofrecer a sus vecinos y clientes diversos productos de uso diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes, el negocio cuenta con mucha acogida debido al tiempo que lleva funcionando y al buen trato con el que atiende a sus clientes. Rosa se vale de el para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Rosa desea adquirir más productos para aumentar el inventario de su negocio y así poder responder a la demanda que suele aumentar durante la temporada navideña. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Rosa, 32, is a mother living with her family in Tambogrande district, an agricultural zone in Piura region, located over four hours from the city of Chiclayo.

She has a small grocery store installed in her home where she offers her neighbors and her customers daily use items among which are first need items and groceries.  The business is well received due to the length of time it’s been in operation and the good customer service she provides.  Rosa relies on it to help her husband support the family’s economy.

Rosa wants to acquire more products to stock her inventory and respond to increased demand during the Christmas season.  She has, therefore, asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Rocio Del Pilar

texts.es:
Rocío es una jovencita de 22 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola de la región Piura que se encuentra situada a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza a través de catálogo, ella siempre está a la busca de nuevos clientes ya que mientras más pedidos realiza, la empresa que le provee de cosméticos le da mayores comisiones. Actualmente  sus principales clientes con sus vecinos y amigos, los cuales la recomiendan con otras personas, lo que ha hecho que su negocio empiece a crecer de modo considerable.

Ella desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de modo que pueda contar con un stock fijo y pueda brindar a sus clientes la oportunidad de contar con los productos que necesitan más rápidamente, sin tener que esperar al fin de mes, cuando llegan los pedidos. Por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Rocío is a young woman of 22 who lives with her family in the district of Tambogrande, an agricultural zone in the Piura region, located more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.

Her work is selling beauty products by catalog, and she is always in search of new customers, because as she places more orders, the company which provides the cosmetics gives her higher commissions. Currently, her main customers are her neighbors and friends, who also recommend her to other people, so that her business has begun to grow considerably. 

She would like to expand her business by purchasing more products, so that she can have a fixed inventory and thus give her customers the opportunity to obtain the products they need more quickly, without having to wait until the end of the month when the orders arrive. For this reason, she has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 700 Peruvian new soles.

loans.use: Buying cosmetics to expand her sales business

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro es un padre de familia de 55 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, uno de los distritos más poblados de la región que se caracteriza por que su población está concentrada mayoritaria en zonas urbano marginales.

Se dedica desde hace más de diez años a la fabricación y comercialización de ladrillos. El cuenta con un pequeño horno fuera del distrito y cuenta también con una clientela fidelizada, debido al tiempo que lleva en el negocio y a la calidad con la que realiza su trabajo se ha hecho bastante conocido.

El se encuentra solicitando un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de material para seguir fabricando más ladrillos, Alejandro es una persona bastante responsable y entregada a su familia. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien tranquilo y de confianza.
texts.en:
Alejandro, 55, is a father living with his wife and children in José Leonardo Ortiz district, one of the most densely populated districts in the region, which is characterized by having its population mostly concentrated in marginal urban zones.

For over ten years he has manufactured and sold bricks.  He has a small kiln outside the district and also has regular customers. Thanks to the time he’s been in business and the quality with which he does his work he has become quite well known.

He is asking for a 2000 new sol loan to buy materials to continue making bricks.  Alejandro is a person who is quite responsible and devoted to his family.  People who know him consider him to be levelheaded and trustworthy.

loans.use: To buy materials to expand brick making business.

loans.name: Leip

texts.en: Leip S. is 31 years of age and a married woman. In order to have cash to meet the needs of the family, Leip S. sells a little grocery inventory out of her home. She has worked in this sector for two years and is earning approximately of $3 per day. To share responsibility for family, her husband always goes to the river where he fishes and then sells on time. This couple is married with two young children who are attending school. Leip S. will use parts of the loan to improve her grocery trade and the rest to buy fishing tools.

loans.use: To improve grocery trade and the rest to buy fishing tools.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
Wilfredo T. is from the village of Minallo. He is 48 years old. Wilfredo is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Wilfredo owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Wilfredo has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 40000 PHP per harvest.

In 2007, Wilfredo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilfredo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Wilfredo is requesting a new loan of 35000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Wilfredo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Loek

texts.en: Mrs. H., 40, is a low-income person living in Siem Reap Province. She is a good and determined mother who tries to ensure that her family attains a good living. She has three single children who live together at home. Mrs. H. and her husband is a local fisherman. Mrs. H. owns a boat and any tools that she and her husband use to fish to earn a living. This couple wakes up in early morning to arrange the tools, and then travels to the middle of the river where they always fish. Actually, some materials are ruined and the fishing is suspended. In view of that, Mrs. H. decided to solve this problem by using a Kiva loan to buy fishing tool for replacing the broken equipment.

loans.use: To buy fishing tool for replacing the broken equipment.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok K. is a hard-working woman who has spent her life cultivating lotus crops. She has a few rental ponds where she grows lotus. Three months after planting, she harvests them to sell. Besides her work, she also goes with her husband to the river where they fish to earn additional income in order to fix the needs of their family. This couple has four school-aged kids who assist in their parent’s job when they are not studying. Sok K. has had great success growing lotus crops, which is an annual process. She is able to plant the crops at least twice a year. Sok K. will be using the loan to replant the lotus crop and buy more tools to fish.

loans.use: To replant the lotus crop and buy more tools to fish.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok C. is 55 years of age and is a mother caring for a young child.  Her other four children are already married and live independently. To earn a daily income, Sok C. owns a boat that she and her husband use to transport people who live along the river. Besides driving the boat, Sok C.’s husband has skills in mending fishing boats and has been using this knowledge to make extra profit. 

The family’s boat is getting old and some parts of the boat are broken. The transporting service is temporally suspended and the family income has been affected. To fix this bad situation, Sok C. requests a loan to replace the broken parts of her boat.

loans.use: To fix broken transport boat

loans.name: Vanessa Claire

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanessa Claire L. is from the Barangay of Maloro, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old, married to Isagani L., and is blessed with 2 children, one is of school age and the other is still an infant. 

To make a living, she is presently engaged in operating a fast food eatery business. She is also receiving support from her husband as an overseas seaman. She’s been engaged in this fast food eatery business for the past 8 years.  She earns an amount of not less than Php 2,500.00 a day. 

In 2008, Vanessa Claire joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vanessa Claire is an active member of Paglaum MPC under the Regular Loan Program, and has successfully repaid a loan amount of Php 150,000.00.   She is now requesting a loan of Php 50,000.00 as her 8th loan, which will be used as additional working capital for her existing fast food eatery business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family -- especially in meeting their basic needs, and to use for future savings, loan repayments, her children’s education, and for possible business expansions.

 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Ibragim

texts.en:
A. Ibragim is 47 years old and married. Together with his wife, they have six children who are still young and attending school. They are farmers who own a plot of land in their village to grow different kinds of crops like wheat, onion, rice and watermelon. They have been in this business since 2005. These crops are the main source of income for their family. To alleviate the hard physical labor and to expand the business, Ibragim would like to apply for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants.    


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.name: Cholpon

texts.en:
Cholpon is an attentive mother of tightly knit family. She has three children, two sons, Daniar and Damir, and the youngest, her most loving daughter, Milana, aged five. Her husband works at the sugar plant but his wage is too low to cover their family’s expenses. 

To find an additional means of subsistence for her family, Cholpon decided to open a grocery store near her house, so she is not far from her children. In 2000, with the revenues from selling groceries, Cholpon with her husband started their cattle-breeding business. They worked hard and managed to enlarge the number of cattle to three bull-calves and one milk cow. With the revenues from this activity, they were able to pay for education to their son, Daniar. 

This year, Cholpon decided to broaden her selling business, so she turned one of the rooms in her house into a small shop. Now, she plans to obtain a loan of 50,000 Kyrgyz Soms to broaden her assortment of goods. It will allow her to increase her sales and also acquire new customers. In the future, Cholpon dreams of opening a big shop with different kinds of goods to fit every client.

About Bai-Tushum:  
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To broaden her assortment of goods

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
This is Vilma G., 56, a widow and a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She has two college-aged children who are still staying at home managing the household and helping her with the business. By the grace of God, Vilma has managed to support her children's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their every day expenses.

Vilma operates an agri-animal business. She buys piglets, raises them for meat and then sells them to slaughter houses to be sold on local markets or slaughters them herself, and then sells them to her immediate community. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 3000 in sales every month.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 14,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more piglets. She will also invest a portion of the loan to buy feed and pay for other nutritional needs of the swine like vaccines and vitamins. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Vilma dreams of continuing her business and live a good and healthy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more piglets, hog feed, and vitamins

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
This is Concepcion C., 55, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Rolando C., A vendor and her business partner. At this time, Concepcion is working hard to be able to support her family financially, like their everyday expenses.

Concepcion operates a retailing business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers, then sell them piecemeal with a little profit. Products can range from furniture to household appliances, electronic devices, clothing and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options they are offered. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php200 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php19, 000 loan. She will be use the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Concepcion dreams to have her house renovated by the end of the year. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
This is Rosita C., 64, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Angel C.. At this time, Rosita is working hard to provide income for her family’s needs like everyday expenses.

Rosita operates a retailing business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers, then sell them piecemeal with a little profit. Products can range from furniture to household appliances, electronic devices, clothing and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options they are offered. Rosita is has  also been intoa  tailoring and curtain making business for ten years now.  She accepts orders from her regular customers who are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php12, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Rosita dreams to have her own commercial space for her tailoring shop as well as for her buying and selling business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy more quantities and varieties of items to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Batma's Group

texts.en:
Batma B. is the leader of this group. She is the resident of Tashkomur, a small town in Jalalabad region.  Batma is 30 and married. Her husband works in construction. Together they bring up four children: a daughter and three sons.  The daughter and the oldest son are at school and the other sons are preschool age (under seven). 

Five years ago with the initial investment of 20000 soms Batma started to breed cattle. She earns money to cover family expense by reselling cattle after fattening at the higher price. Batma applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase a cow and a calf for breeding. In the future she wants to purchase a vehicle and improve their living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and a calf

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
This is Jocelyn A., 40, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is working hard to earn an income for her family, especially for her daily needs.

Jocelyn operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than individual meals. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php250 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php14, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Jocelyn dreams to have her house renovated by the end of the year and continue to live a happy and healthy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings

loans.name: Estella

texts.en:
No one wants uncertainties in life, and our CCT* Partner, Estella E. or Stella for short, aims to eliminate uncertainties in her future and in the future of her children. At 51, Stella was separated from her husband, but it does not make her stop dreaming for a great future for her six children. Stella and her children reside in Caloocan City, Philippines.

Estella's current business is direct selling, in which she buys products such as clothes and shoes and sell them to her neighbors, business connections, and friends. With no official space for her business, Stella faces the hassles of the streets everyday just to bring her products closer to her market, who are people in the community. Estella has been in business for fifteen years now, and so she makes sure that she maintains the business that she has developed. Stella earns around Php400 everyday.

At present, Estella wants to be certain that she will earn profit and help meet the needs of her customers at the same time. To help her continue operations her business, she would like to apply for a Php26,000 loan. She plans to use the money she would get to increase the line of products she is offering to her customers. With these, she makes certain that her customers would appreciate additional options and would frequently come back to her with more orders. 

On her own without a life partner to hold on to, Estella nonetheless makes sure that her future with her children will never be uncertain and full of fear. With a business she keeps up the good health for everyone in the family, she is certain that a life well lived for her family is surely attainable. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.name: Armenia

texts.en:
Staying with the Center for Community Transformation as a community partner and volunteering as Fellowship* Group Coordinator for five years has brought Armenia C. (Armie) a lot of entrepreneurial knowledge and business opportunities. At 55 and having finished college, Armie has already accomplished something in business. She is married and has three children, with whom she resides in Caloocan.

Armenia is into the retailing business. She buys and sells ready to wear (RTW) clothing, kitchenware, and silver jewelry. These she sells to friends and business connections in her community. Armenia's business fares quite well as she earns around P350 a day.

Looking for more opportunities to make her business grow, Armenia would like to apply for a Php22,000 loan. She plans to use this money to purchase more items to add to her retailing business. She plans to do this in order to increase the capacity of her business to earn a good profit. Just like any other entrepreneur, she desires to see her business grow and become one that is beneficial not only for her but for the community as a whole.

At the bottom of it all, Armenia does this for her family. She wants to secure the future of her family by providing for their needs and preparing for their future. At present, she prays for good health for the entire family.


*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

texts.en:
Mrs. Em T., 33 is married to Soeun, 33, and they are local farmers living in a wooden house located in Kompong Cham province. The couple  married many years ago and are blessed to two young kids who are enrolled in the secondary school. Em T. is widely known in the farming trade and has had great success growing a variety type of crops, which is an annual process. She is able to plant crops and uses the tools and techniques inherited from her grandparents, who are now deceased. 

This season, Em T. planted onions on a big farmland, but the crops are not growing well because of lack fertilizer. That is why she has requested a loan to use towards buying fertilizer to improve her onion yield.

K. is a hard-working woman who has spent almost of her life growing crops. She is a middle-age woman and is raising  a school-aged child . Her husband appears in the photo. She owns a small plot of land inherited from  her parents in which she plants various crops. Additionally she built a pig pen and raises hogs for extra income. . K. has another plot of land which is full of grass, and it is not being farmed. 

K. is taking out a loan to clean up the grass from the land where she will raise additional crops. With the remainder of the loan, she will purchase piglets to breed.

loans.name: Alymbek

texts.en:
Alymbek K. is a hard-working 39-year-old farmer from Karakol. He is married and has four children between the ages of 3 and 11 years old. His wife is a teacher at the local school. 

After serving in the army, he worked in a meat-packing plant. To find additional means of subsistence for his large family, in 2000, Alymbek decided to start his own livestock-breeding business. With initial capital of only 3,000 Kyrgyz Soms, he bought a bull calf and managed to enlarge his stock to one cow, one heifer, one bull and nine sheep.
  
Now Alymbek needs to develop his farm, so he applied for a loan of 120,000 Kyrgyz Soms. With the revenues from this investment, he will make his dream come true - to provide a good education for his children. In the future, he plans to expand his business by purchasing more cattle to raise.

loans.name: Ulanbek

texts.en:
Ulanbek A. is 42 years old, married, and has four children. He lives with his family in Oruktam Village. After serving in the army, he graduated from State University and worked as a history teacher at the local school. Owing to his devoted attitude and high professionalism, in 2006, he was appointed to the post of School Director. 

Unfortunately, salaries in rural areas are very low and do not cover all expenses of the household. To find an additional means of subsistence for his family, in 1994, Ulanbek started breeding cattle. With initial capital of 2,000 Kyrgyz Soms, he bought cattle and managed to enlarge its number to three cows, one bull calf, two sheep and three horses. Today he has an income of 5,000 Kyrgyz Soms per month.
  
Now, Ulanbek wants a loan 50,000 Kyrgyz Soms to buy more cattle. With the revenues from this loan, Ulanbek plans to expand his farm by breeding livestock.

As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

Joie, as a newly recognized member of Paglaum MPC under the Regular Loan Program, is requesting a loan of Php5,000.00 for her first loan which will be used as additional capital for their business buying, selling and roasting pigs.  About PMPC:

texts.en:

He has applied for a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He believes he will earn enough income to educate his children. He is planning a pure-breed farm. He gets additional income from a transportation business.

Joseph's challenge is prolonged drought, which results in scarce or expensive animal feed. He is, however, happy with Juhudi's financial services.

loans.use: Purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia has successfully repaid her first Kiva loan! With the loan she financed and sustained the increasing demand for her bamboo furniture set making business. She is very thankful for your support and the opportunity to borrow money from Kiva. 

Herminia is very happy that with the loan she was able to provide satisfactory services, without delays, to her regular customers when requesting their orders. She wishes to access a larger loan to expand her bamboo set (furniture) business in order to earn more profit. Herminia thanks KIVA for providing her with the opportunity to increase her income. Your support is important to her family and they are very grateful.

Prior to ASHI, Herminia had no access to capital to support her business endeavour. She joined Kiva partner ASHI in order to follow her dream of providing a decent life for her family.  From this inspiration, she took a loan and started her own bamboo set business. As she continues to take loans from ASHI and save some of her profits, she will be able to grow her business. 

With the loan, Herminia has noticed that her monthly income has almost doubled since she has attracted new customers with her additional inventory of bamboo furniture.

Now she is requesting another Kiva loan of 25,000 Philippine pesos to maintain her business and to purchase an inventory of raw materials needed. 

With the support of ASHI and Kiva, she is hopeful that her business will generate a steady income which will improve her financial stability and her family’s quality of life to lift them out of poverty.

loans.use: To support her business and to purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Ngara Group

texts.en:
Selina M. is in her mid-forties and divorced with five children.  For a year, she has been selling soda, juice, water and cake.  Her shop is open from 8 am to 10 pm daily.  She makes a small profit.  

This will be Selina's first loan with Kiva partner Tujijenge Tanzania. She hopes to use this loan to buy more water, juice and sodas and sell more cakes at a place called Kiluvya, a few kilometers from the city center. Selina's dream is to start selling chips and mishkaki (shish kebabs) in the same area.

Selina will share the loan with her loan group Ngara, which totals 21 members.  The group members will hold each other accountable in repaying the loan.  

In the photo, Selina can be seen seated in the front row, far left, with a brown dress and a blue scarf on her head.

loans.use: To buy more water, juice and sodas

Mercedita is a fish vendor. She buys directly from the fishermen in her town and resells their catch. She can buy the fish at a lower price and increase it when she sells the fish. 

Mercedita joined Kiva partner CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercedita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Mercedita is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to resell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her child's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia B., from the village of Cabuan, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province, is 47 years old, married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Amalia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, snack foods and canned goods in the local community. She also buys and sells coconuts. Amalia has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Amalia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is now requesting a new loan, her third, of 9000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. Amalia plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As working capital and to purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Wesley

texts.en:
Wesley is a resident of Litein Town in South Rift Kenya.  He has been doing dairy farming for five years and selling the milk he produces to Kenya Co-Operative Creameries.  He has two children ages eight and five years old.

Wesley has applied for a loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow.  He believes the dairy cow will provide enough milk for family consumption and additional income to that generated by growing tea.

Fluctuation of milk prices remains the greatest challenge.  He is pleased with Juhudi Kilimo services.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia J., from the town of Trinidad, is 35 years old, married and has four children aged 16, 15, 10 and 5. To make a living, Anastacia owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting rice for sale. Working hard to achieve a better life, she hopes to establish her own sari-sari store soon to help in their daily needs.

Anastacia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting her first loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

texts.ru: Абиров Хамза проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 38 лет. Женат. Имеет 4 детей. Образование средне - специальное, бухгалтер. Работает главным бухгалтером в больнице. Кроме того он занимается растениеводством. Арендует земельный участок, где выращивает овощи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 10 лет. Кредит берет для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений. Он хочет посеить и получить хороший урожай для продажи.
texts.en: Hamza A. lives in Shahrituz.  He is 38 years old, married, and has four children.  He has a vocational education as a bookkeeper.  He works as the head accountant in a hospital.  Additionally, he farms.  He rents the plot of land where he grows vegetables.  He has been doing this work for ten years.  He is taking a loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers.  He wants to sow the seeds and to reap a good harvest to sell.

loans.use: buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is a resident of Kisii Town in Western Kenya.  She is married with four children between the ages of four and eleven years old.  She has been doing mixed farming for five years, selling her produce of eggs, beans, maize and bananas locally.

She has applied for a loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow.  She reckons it will provide enough milk for the family and generate stable income for basic needs like clothing and school fees.  She foresees herself having a vehicle to transport her produce to the market.

Josphine's challenge are low market prices coupled with animal diseases.

Fortunata A. is in her late-thirties and is married with four children.  She has had a poultry business for one year.  The business is open from 7.00 am to 6.00 pm daily and makes a good monthly profit.

This will be Fortunata's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to buy chicken feed and equipment for the poultry business.

Fortunata will share this loan with her loan group Asernal, which has 15 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

In the picture, Fortunata is 1st on the left second row, in a blue and white dress.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret N. lives in the Kawempe Bubajwe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, two of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren).   

Margaret has a business selling mattresses and cushions.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Margaret sells her products in a retail shop.  Margaret has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more mattresses and cushions. 

The main business challenges for Margaret include transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to be a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land for her business premise.  Margaret lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent for her business premise, school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more mattresses and cushions for resale

Elle va utiliser son prêt pour acheter les fertilisantes urées et NPK, et aussi pour la main d’œuvre.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est l’amélioration de l’activité actuelle de l’agriculture du riz.  Elle voudrait accroitre l’activité actuelle, et acheter une maison.
texts.en: Médiatrice K. is a rice farmer and she is a member of the Abatiganda group. She is 27 years old, married and has one child who is two years old. She is going to use her loan to buy urea fertilizers and NPK, as well to cover labor costs. Her strategy for building up her business is to improve her present rice farming activity. She would like to grow her present activity and also buy a house.

loans.name: Roel

texts.en: Roel Z. is from the village of Waterfall, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. He is 38 years old. Roel is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Roel provides repair services for cars, jeepneys and multi-purpose cabs to local community members. He is also engaged in planting and harvesting vegetables like onions. Roel has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Roel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase tools needed to provide service. Roel is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tools needed to expand services provided. This will be the second loan taken out by Roel from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tools needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Janes

texts.en:
Janes is a resident of Kisii Town Western Kenya.  She is married with four children between the ages of ten and fifteen years of age.  She has been practicing mixed farming and selling her produce of maize, tea and vegetables locally.

She has requested for a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow.  She believes the cow will provide milk for family consumption as well as income to educate the children.  She is focusing on purchasing a parcel of land to expand her farming business.

Her challenges are insecurity, low market prices and skills.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Lochin

texts.ru: Ашурматов Лочин проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 40 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее. Более 10 лет занимается растениеводством. Арендует земельный участок, где выращивает овощи и сеет бобовые культуры для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений и топлива для трактора.
texts.en: Lochin A. lives in Shahrituz.  He is 40 years old, married, and has four children.  He has a high school education.  He has been farming for more than ten years.  He rents the plot of land where he grows legumes and vegetables.  He is taking a loan mineral fertilizers and fuel for a tractor.

loans.use: Закуп минеральных удобрений и топлива
